loans.name: Tabatsufinu Group

texts.en:
Aminata C. (second from left) is the leader of this group. Aminata has been selling shoes, cigarettes, sardines, milk, corn beef, etc. for three years now. She is married to a police officer and they have three children together. Two of their children are in secondary school and one is in primary school. Aminata was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone, 32 years ago. 

Aminata C., Fatu K., Maliki S. and Marie T. call their group Tabatsufinu, a Temne phrase meaning "Be Kind to Us." They are business people based in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make better profit and consequently improve on their wellbeing.

loans.use: To invest in retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for sale

loans.name: Naseem Muhammad Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji, the a wife of M. A., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 19 years. She is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business sewing clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. Since she is a very supportive lady, she also did this work to help her father before she was married. Her husband is a fruit merchant. He buys fruits wholesale and sells to the fruit shops. He also treks to different areas to earn income. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit business.

This loan is consists of three additional people. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy frozen chickens to sell. Bilquis baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Naseem A. baji is seated first from the left in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Bonie

texts.en:
Bonie P. is from the village of Zone 2, Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 45 years old. Bonie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Bonie plants, harvests, and sells a variety of vegetables. Bonie has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bonie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Bonie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income and support the eduction of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ferrari Group

texts.en:
Laila M., age 34 is married with one son of two years.  She has a grocery store which she started since 2006.   She works from 9am to10pm daily and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $.113.

This will be Laila’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her business, bought chairs, empty crates and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase on business by buying a blender to start selling juice, is going to stat selling water whole sale and bites as well.

Laila will share this loan with her loan group, Ferrari which totals 19 members.  These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Laila  is second from left front row.

loans.use: To increase on business by buying a blender and start selling juice,water  whole sale and start selling bites.

loans.name: Dul

texts.en: Dul S. is 30 years old and lives with her husband in the Phnom Penh. Since 2006, she has been selling food and grocery items to earn a living, and is able to make about US$3 of profit every day, while her husband makes US$2 working as a teacher. This couple has one young child. Dul S. is asking for a loan of US$400 to fix her leaking roof.

loans.use: To fix a leaking roof.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 48 años, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudiantes y uno, mayor de edad. Vive junto  a su esposo en la casa de sus suegros. Ella cuenta en una chacra de 5 hectáreas de palma aceitera, pero también siembra yuca y frutos cítricos, y cría gallinas. Para estas labores cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se siente feliz de tener a su a lado a una mujer muy trabajadora. En esta actividad ya tiene un periodo de 2 años, pues anteriormente se dedicaba a la crianza de cerdos, con lo que no le fue bien por los constantes robos que sufría. Lo que le gusta a Zoila de su trabajo es estar en constante actividad, pero lo que más le satisface es la cosecha de sus productos y observar cómo sus plantas van creciendo cada día. Zoila considera que su negocio le es rentable porque todos sus productos los lleva ella misma a vender al mercado de su zona, obteniendo un buen precio y por ende buenas ganancias.
Este es su 4to crédito con MFP y lo que más le gusta trabajar de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son muy comprensivos y trabajadores. Le dinero que solicita lo invertirá en su íntegramente en su chacra, comprando abono y alimentos para sus animales.

loans.use: Compra de abono y alimento para sus animales

loans.name: La Flor Group

texts.es:
el grupo denominado la flor esta ubicado en el barrio altos de la flor de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  esta conformado por tres miembros quienes ya tienen mucho tiempo de estar trabajando juntos y tienen el deseo de mejorar sus negocios. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el señor Roque N. N. es casado, tiene 52 años de edad y se dedica al comercio, tiene una 
pulperia hace 6 años donde trabaja junto con su esposa. Tiene la intencion de surtir su negocio con nuevos productos.
 
el señor Jose Rafael B. O. es casado y tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta
de sal al por mayor en la ciudad de San Lorenzo y en otras localidades.
ahorita el desea comprar la sal a un precio barato y una cantidad grande ya que dentro de poco el precio va a subir y asi tendra mejores ganancias.

la señora Maria Victorina M. B. tiene 55 años de edad y se dedica a la venta 
de nacatamales, leña y tortillas.  ella vende estos productos en su casa de habitacion, esta ocupacion le ha servido para mejorar su nivel de vida, necesita invertir el credito en compra de leña y maiz  aprovechando la temporada  de cocecha ya que el precio esta bajo, de esta manera 
tendra un porcntaje mas de ganancia.
texts.en:
The group called "La Flor" (The Flower) is located in the Altos de la Flor neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. It is made of three members who have been working together for a long time, and who all want to improve their businesses. These are the details of the businesses of the three members:

Mr. Roque N. N. is married. He is 52 years old, and has a business. He has had a grocery store for six years, where he works with his wife. He would like to stock his business with new products.

Mr. Jose Rafael B. O. is married and 42 years old. He sells salt wholesale in the city of San Lorenzo and other places. Right now, he wants to buy a large amount of salt at a low price, because the price is going to rise soon, and this way he will earn a better profit.

Mrs. Maria Victorina M. B. is 55 years old, and sells Nicaraguan tamales, firewood, and tortillas. She sells these products from her home, and this occupation has helped her improve her quality of life. She needs to invest her loan in buying firewood and corn, taking advantage of the harvest season because prices are lower, so that she can earn a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, firewood, pasta, rice, chicken, milk, salt

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is married with 6 children, and she is 48 years old. She is a focused hard worker. She sells daily from 7:00 am–6:30 pm. She sells foodstuff like yam tubers and plantains at the front of her house. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
Ema  es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 40 años, es madre de cuatro hijos. Ema se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, pues tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa; además vende frutas en el mercado Bellavista. Su esposo es trabajador independiente. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Caribeñas” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de frutas.
En la actualidad Ema necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de telas de algodón para confeccionar ropas interiores. También comprará frutas de la región para vender en el mercado Bellavista. La meta de Ema es llegar a tener una bodega bien implementada.
texts.en:
Ema is a hardworking and dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 40 years old, and is the mother of four children. Ema makes clothes and has a small dressmaking workshop in her house. In addition, she sells fruit in the Bellavista market. Her husband is self employed. She has been a member of the communal bank "Las Caribeñas" for one year - the first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she used to buy fruit. Currently, Ema needs a loan of $350 which will be used to buy cotton cloth to make underwear. She will also buy regional fruits to sell in the Bellavista market. Ema's goal is to have a well set-up store.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cotton cloth to make underwear and to buy regional fruits

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen B. is the devoted and ingenuous wife of Primo B., 55, a construction worker and supportive husband. They live happily at Tagbak, Antipolo City. Belen has been a member of Kiva partner ASHI (which means "Rise up from poverty") for three years, and understands the advantages of joining the institution.
Belen has experienced an unhappy life because her parents are poor and less educated. She works hard in order to provide for her family's daily needs. She has been blessed with eight children, four of whom are already married with the remaining four still being dependants. Due to poverty she has been unable to afford a good education for her children, which is why they only finished high school; instead, she was forced to work hard just to feed them. However, Belen needs to move on and is looking forward to having opportunities to change their lives.
When ASHI encouraged Belen to take the opportunity of a loan, she grabbed it because she knows it could help her family achieve its dreams. She is requesting her third loan of 15,000 PHP to be used for a sari-sari (variety) store. She wants to purchase eight sacks of rice (8,000 PHP), 10 sacks of "uling" or charcoal (1,500 PHP), and other items for her sari-sari store amounting to 6,000 PHP.
Belen is looking forwards to ASHI's utmost support and is thankful for the good hearts of Kiva lenders for making her family's dreams and wishes come true. In the future, Belen would like to have a grocery store and be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of rice, ten sacks of "uling" (charcoal) and other items

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio P. G. es un señor de 50 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una  comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio.

Don Julio se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de plátano desde hace 10 años. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.

En estos momentos don Julio desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢675 ,000 (seiscientos setenta y cinco  mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su cosecha además comprar fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto poder incrementar la producción. 

Don Julio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Julio Perez Gonzalez is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a community called Canalete, located in Upala in the province of Alajuela. It is a somewhat mountainous place, and its economic activities mainly center around agriculture and raising livestock. It is a community with a great opportunity for development and the establishment of small companies, agroindustry as much as commercial trade. Julio works in agriculture, specifically sowing plantains, which he has done for 10 years. He says that the market for this product is very good. Thanks to this project, his quality of life has improved considerably, and furthermore, he has grown as a person and has acquired a lot of knowledge. At the moment, Julio wishes to obtain a microcredit of 675,000 colones to help maintain his harvest and to purchase fertilizers and other supplies. With this investment, he hopes to attain a good harvest, with products of the appropriate characteristics to obtain a high sales price, to be able to increase his production. Julio is a partner of the Empresa de Credito Comunal Canalete, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level, as well as actively participating in his community's credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for sowing and maintaining plantain

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Pedro tiene 36 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos que dependen de él: Sandra tiene 12 años y Fabricio tiene 6 años. El socio Pedro vive en la ciudad de Calca departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio se dedica a la elaboración de panes. El socio nos cuenta que sus padres le enseñaron la elaboración de panes desde muy niño y ahora tiene su propio horno donde produce 420 panes entre los especiales y empanadas por día. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura y leña. El socio esta pensado producir panteón para esta campaña navideña.   
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Pedro is 36 years old, lives with his partner, and has two children who depend on him: Sandra is 12 years old and Fabricio is 6 years old. Pedro lives in the city of Calca, in the department of Cusco, and belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Asunta" which is part of the Arariwa Association.

Pedro makes bread. He tells us that his parents taught him how to make bread when he was a small child, and now he has his own oven where he produces 420 loaves of bread per day, between the specials and the empanadas. He has been in this business for 15 years and it has been very good for him thanks to all of the effort he puts into his work. He is a hard-working father and businessman who gets his family ahead. He requires the loan in order to buy more consumables such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, and firewood. He is thinking about making a special bread, panettone, for the Christmas season.

Pedro is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and likewise commits to complete the payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He requires the loan to purchase more consumables such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, and firewood.

loans.name: Arceli's Group

texts.en: Arceli B. is from the village of Cabisera 25. She is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Arceli B.’s Group. Arceli is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Arceli joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
l Sr. Eladio A.  es  de la localidad de Roque Gonzalez y se encuentra dentro de la Ciudad de Carapegua, tiene 39 años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad.
Hace 10 años comenzó con  una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, además de eso se dedica al servicio de construcción de obras, gracias a este ingreso fue acrecentando su negocio que hoy día cuenta con una despensa bien surtida.
Su negocio está ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad que  favorece la comercialización de sus productos.
Viendo la demanda actual de su negocio se acercó hasta nuestra institución para solicitar  préstamo para la compra de bebidas, embutidos, lácteos y panificados.
texts.en:
Eladio A., 39, is originally from Roque Gonzalez; he lives in the city of Carapegua. He is married and has three, minor children. Ten years ago he set up a small grocery store in his home. In addition to that, he also works in construction. Thanks to this income, he gradually enlarged his store and today it is a well-stocked store. His business is located in a strategic location in the city that is favorable for his sales. Seeing the high demand for his products, he called upon our institution to request funding to buy beverages, canned goods, dairy products and baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, sugar, rice, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods.

loans.name: Heyler Geovany

texts.es:
El Joven Heyler Geovany C. es soltero vive con sus padres y tres hermanos tiene un buen espíritu de superación en su familia y su trabajo, es empleado activo de la alcaldía Chinandega en el departamento de contabilidad.
El joven Heyler C. trabaja con créditos desde hace dos años, ha tenido cinco créditos el cual ha demostrado responsabilidad en la administración de ellos.  
El joven C. L. utiliza el crédito para ayudar a sus padres, ya que ellos se dedican a la siembra para el consumo  propio y otra parte para comercializar, pero en pocas cantidades, ya que su mayor preocupación es si la cosecha le será rentable al hacerlo en mayor proporción.
texts.en:
The young Heyler Geovany C. is single and lives with his parents and three siblings. He has a good spirit with his family and his job. Currently, he is employed at the mayor's office in the accounting department. He has been working with credit for two years now, and he has demonstrated responsibility in managing five loans. This credit will be used to help his parents, who work in agriculture, both for their own consumption and for commercialization. However, they do it in small quantities, since their biggest worry is whether the harvest will be profitable for them if they do it in greater proportion.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover family expenses

loans.name: Adewumi

texts.en:
Adewumi is 35 and married with three children. She sells food stuff like yams and garri to her customers at retail. (Garri comes from cassava and is consumed by most Nigerians as a meal in itself.) Adewumi has earned her living from this business for 15 years. 

Adewumi want to improve and expand her business in the future. She is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more garri and yams to sell as this will put her in a better position to assist her husband in paying for their children’s education and provide for other family needs. She appreciates all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more garri and yams to sell.

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unidos 4 Group

texts.en: Evelyn, 41, is a borrower who lives in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Sabanalamarino ("Sabana the Sailor") and her story is representative of other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International. Evelyn is a single mother who lives with her three children in Hato Mayor, a small rural town in the heart of the agricultural east in the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to health care among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Evelyn has a successful small business selling new clothing to her friends and those in her community. With this loan, she plans to purchase new clothing for resale. This is Evelyn’s fourth loan with Esperanza International; in a year and a half, she has been able to more than double her loan size, a true testament to her hard work. With continued profits, Evelyn hopes to keep the growth of her business going. Evelyn’s profits have already improved her family’s living conditions, and she looks forward to continuing that trend. The added income has also helped secure a good education for her children and buy supplies for their schooling. Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. There are over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for your loan to Evelyn and the Sabanalamarino group!

loans.use: To buy new clothing for resale

loans.name: Kanouya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kanouya de l’association Dounkafa est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe Kanouya font de la restauration et le commerce d’articles divers. 
Pour rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y'a une année. 
Après le premier prêt solidaire remboursé sans aucune difficulté, ce groupe est à son deuxième prêt.
Bernadette D. est un des membres du groupe qui évolue dans le secteur de la restauration depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle est très sollicitée, appréciée et enviée grâce à la qualité de ses prestations. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs de céréales et une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et vend dans son restaurant situé aux abords de l’artère principale reliant Tominian à Beninna à une clientèle constituée généralement  de routiers.
Elle espère réaliser tout comme les autres membres du groupe Kanouya    un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elle  ambitionne avoir un montant  plus élevé pour se ravitaille de condiments en gros à Bamako.
texts.en:
The Kanouya group of the Dounkafa association is made up of married women from the town of Tominian in Segou, the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families and are on average 28 years old with at least four children. Women in the group are in the restaurant business and the trading of various goods. The group members decided about a year ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit loan programme to increase their activities’ profits. After correctly reimbursing the first group loan, the group is now requesting a second loan. Bernadette D. is one of the group’s members who has been in the restaurant business for the past ten years. She is very much in demand, both appreciated and envied due to the quality of her food preparations. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy bags of grain cereals and a large quantity of food condiments. She gets her supplies locally and runs a restaurant close by the main road linking Tominian to Beninna, to mainly truck driver customers. She – as well as the other members of the Kanouva group - is hoping to attain monthly earnings of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to reimburse the loan and deal with daily family expenses. Her ambition is to be granted a larger loan so that she can buy condiments wholesale in Bamako.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the restaurant business

loans.name: Cielito Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal CIELITO  en su Secuencia 3, está formado por 8 clientes, esta conformado por 6 mujeres y 2 varones, los componentes de la banca viven en diferentes zonas  pero que están ubicados por zonas aledañas a las oficinas de Emprender, las socias se dedican a la venta de diversos productos como ser, venta de ropa, taller mecánico, elaboración de mantas, la confección y venta de deportivos.

La Sra. Rosa Es una de las representantes  de la banca comunal, ocupa el cargo de presidenta del banco la señora vive en la zona de Pampahasi  desde muy pequeña, viven en dos habitaciones alquiladas. La señora tiene un pequeño taller  de costura  ella trabaja principalmente con mano de obra ya que ella recibe cortes de tela (telas cortadas en cantidad para alguna empresa o pequeñas microempresas) para costura y  posterior entrega de prendas, ella aprendió este oficio hace 7 años atrás en el Paiz de la Argentina  donde permaneció cerca de 2 años al regresar se caso y pasado un año instalo su pequeño taller. Su familia esta compuesta de la señora Rosa, su esposo Néstor y su hija cielo  la cual tiene 5  años de edad. Una de sus metas es lograr comprar una casa , equipar mejor su taller para tener sus propios clientes en costura el destino del credito es para la compra de una maquina de coser ya que una sola no es suficiente para los pedidos que tiene.

La Sra. Rebeca, actualmente toma el cargo de la secretaria de actas del banco se dedica elaboración y venta de mantas, realiza trabajos a pedido  cuenta con esta actividad hace 1 año, el préstamo será destinado para aumentar el capital  compra de lana y el material necesario. La señora comenta que el empezó a convivir con su esposo  hace 3 años   ella estudiaba y  vendía flores en el mercado Rodrigues el mercado mas populoso de la ciudad de la Paz, hasta que el  esposo sufrió un accidente y tuvo que buscar otros ingresos adicionales, allí aprendió a elaborar mantas junto a la suegra lo que le permitió  sobrellevar el problema que estaba atravesando en ese momento  esto sucedió hace un año actualmente la señora se esta logrando estabilizar económicamente. Su meta y sueño es tener su propio taller con maquinas de tejer y  mas adelante   tener una casa propia  y  progresar junto familia. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos y muy alegre aunque bastante joven.

La Sra. Alejandrina  Socia  nueva   es elegida como jefa de grupo por las características que se dan a conocer  en el proceso del crédito, la señora vive en  Villa Salome  en la casa de su suegra en la cual ocupa 2 cuartos y una pequeña cocina, vive con el esposo y sus tres hijos. La señora decide empezar con la venta de fruta  para ayudar al esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que dos de sus hijos ya están en  la escuela y necesitan  para su alimentación y para la vestimenta, comienza a trabajar desde las 5 de la mañana y vende hasta las 6 de la tarde, el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital en frutas según la temporada. Una de sus metas es sacar  a sus hijos adelante para que en adelante desean profesionales  de manera que nunca les falte nada y mas adelante poder comprar un terreno para su familia.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras con ganas de superacion que desean mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The CIELITO Communal Bank, in its third loan cycle, is made up of eight clients; six women and two men. The members of the bank live in different areas but their businesses are located in areas near the offices of Emprender. The various products and services offered by the members include selling clothing, auto repair, making blankets, tailoring, and selling sporting goods. Rosa is one of the representatives of the communal bank and serves as its president. She lives in two rented rooms in the Pampahasi area where she has lived since she was very young. She has a small sewing workshop and works primarily by hand as she receives cuts of fabric (fabric cut in quantity for businesses or small micro-businesses) for sewing and later delivery of garments. She learned this trade 7 years ago in Argentina where she lived for about two years. After returning, she got married and spent a year setting up her small workshop. The members of her family include her husband Nestor and her daughter Cielo who is 5 years old. One of her goals is to buy a house. She would also like to better equip her workshop in order to have her own sewing customers. The purpose of the loan is for the purchase of a sewing machine as one machine is not enough to handle her orders. Rebeca is the bank’s recording secretary. She has been selling made to order blankets for one year. The loan will be used to raise capital for the purchase of wool and necessary material. She says that she has been living with her husband for three years. She was studying and selling flowers in the Rodrigues market, the most populous market in the city of La Paz, until her husband had an accident and she had to seek additional sources of income. She learned to make blankets along with her mother-in-law which allowed her to cope with the problem she was experiencing. At the time this happened, a year ago today, she was struggling to stabilize herself financially. Her goal and dream is to have her own workshop with weaving machines and later have her own house and make progress along with her family. In her communal bank, she stands out as responsible, punctual in her payments, and very light-hearted, although she is quite young. Alejandrina, a new member, was elected as manager of the group based on leadership qualities which became evident during the loan process. She lives in Villa Salome in her mother-in-law’s house in which she occupies two rooms and a small kitchen. She lives with her husband and three children. She has decided to start selling fruit to help her husband with the household expenses as two of her children are in school and need food and clothing. She works from 5:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. The loan she is requesting will be used to raise capital to buy seasonal fruits. One of her goals is to give her children a good education in life so that in the future they will pursue professional careers and will never lack anything. Later, she would like to be able to buy land for her family. All members are responsible and hard-working individuals who have a desire for self-improvement and want to improve the quality of life for their whole family. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting them with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A SEWING MACHINE

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El señor Andres tiene 35 años. Esta casado con Georgina Larrea y tiene tres hijos menores de edad.
El se dedica a la compra y venta de electrodomésticos pequeños, ademas de calzados deportivos, termos forrados, prendas de vestir , juegos de sabanas y otros.  Trabaja en este negocio desde el año 2005.
El necesita de este crédito para adquirir edredones, estufas, secarropas y otros pedidos que recibe para esta nueva temporada que inicia.
Don Andres realiza sus ventas y cobranza en una motocicleta. En el futuro desea comprar un vehículo tipo camioneta para poder realizar sus tareas con mayor seguridad y ampliar su clientela, de esta forma podrá mejorar sus ingresos y brindar mayor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
35-year old Sr. Andres is married to Georgina Larrea and has three young children. He buys and sells small appliances, as well as sport shoes, thermos flasks, clothing, bedding etc. He has been doing this since 2005. Andres needs this loan to buy comforters, heaters, clothes driers etc. to complete the orders from his customers for the upcoming cold season. Andres travels by motorbike to make his sales and collect payments. In the future he would like to buy a small truck for these tasks as it would provide greater safety and allow him to expand his customer base. He would then earn more money and provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, small electric appliances

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en: Erdenebat is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in their own house. His daugther, Munkhchuluun, is 14 years old and attends a local secondary school. His younger daughter, Munkhchimeg, is three years old and attends kindergarten. During the day, Erdenebat’s wife, Tsogzol, operates a trading business at a local market called Narantuul. She operates a retail business and purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. She started her business in 2000 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs ( about $362). After years of successful operations, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 2,000,000 tugrugs (about $1,445) today. Erdenebat operates a transportation business in his local area. Erdenebat is now requesting a loan for his wife's business to purchase a variety of products in Ereen, a Chinese border town, to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, tiene 43 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo (Emerson tiene 15 años). Su actividad económica principal es llevar verduras a Puerto Maldonado. Ella viaja los días miércoles a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y vende sus productos los días jueves, viernes y sábados en el campo ferial de la “Alameda”.  Ella requiere el préstamo completar el dinero que le falta para comprar sus productos. Ya es un año que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.

Su sueño de Alicia es comprar un carro para poder trasladar sus productos a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado.
texts.en:
Alicia is 43 years old and the single mother of one son (Emerson, age 15). Her main business is bringing vegetables to Puerto Maldonado. On Wednesdays, she travels to the city of Puerto Maldonado, and she sells her products on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays in the Alameda market. She needs a loan so that she will have enough money to buy her products to sell. She has participated in her communal bank for one year now, and it is going very well for her. Alicia's dream is to buy a car so that she can transport her products to the city of Puerto Maldonado.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is a widow who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Sitio Pangpang, Barangay Tiglawig, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental, with her seven children who are from 24 to 41 years old. Celsa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,500. Celsa is now borrowing Php 10,000 so that she can continue her general store business. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Celsa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera B. is from the village of Mibanting, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Sotera owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Sotera has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Sotera joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sotera is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Launiu

texts.en:
Launiu M. is 36 and married with 5 children (ages 1 - 16).  She owns a business planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Launiu has two years of experience in this business.  Launiu needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2007, Launiu joined SPBD. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Launiu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:  

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Beti Laiva

texts.es:
La Sra. Beti   está  casada, ella  se dedica a la compra de materiales reciclables, lo cual lo transforma y los vende como productos terminados de modo de ejemplo de estos productos, son veladores de hierro, adornos de botellas de plástico, bolsos de plásticos, etc. 

Teniendo en cuenta los aspectos en cuanto a  mejorar el nivel de vida a través del reciclaje y el adecuado precio de sus productos, tienen un buen ingreso a través de sus ventas. 
El costo de la materia prima es muy inferior en relación al precio de costo.
Es una persona con mucho talento y ganas de trabajar, merece recibir apoyo necesario.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas productos reciclados.
texts.en:
Beti is married and buys and sells recyclables, which she transforms into other products. Examples are iron lamps, decorations made from plastic bottles, plastic bags, etc. Considering the prospects of improving her quality of life through recycling and the price she gets for her finished products, she makes a good profit from her sales. The cost of raw materials is very low in relation to her sale prices. She is a very talented person with a desire to work. She deserves the necessary support and is asking for this loan to buy more recyclables.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita es socia del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa Ayudémonos en Quechua.
Benita es soltera y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Benita tiene un restaurante llamado Katia en un local alquilado, Benita inicio su negocio vendiendo de manera ambulatoria y hace 2 años tiene un local, además vende bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 1 persona y también sus hijos en sus tiempos libres.
Benita solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Benita son tener otro restaurante e implementar un bar.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the Yanapanakusun communal bank. In Quechua, Yanapanakusun means “Let’s help each other.”

Benita is single and has 4 children who are students. She has a restaurant named Katia in a rented space. She began her business by selling on foot and she has had the restaurant for 2 years. She also sells drinks every day, which she does with the help of another person as well as her children when they are free.

Benita is requesting a 1000 PEN loan for the purchase of rice and sugar. Benita’s dreams are to have another restaurant and to set up a bar.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: G.s. Moises Group

texts.es: La señora Tomasa tiene 30 años es casada y tiene tres hijos, todos menores de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de productos varios, es decir peines, colas, aros, prensa pelos, etc. Ella ya tiene más de 5 años de estar trabajando en esta actividad, vendiendo ambulante en los departamentos de Managua, Carazo, Rivas Masaya y Granada. Cabe señalarse, el negocio surgió con recursos propios, vendiendo en las calles con una bolsa, empezó el negocio debido a la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos. Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en comprar más cosméticos y otros artículos para vendérselos a su clientela que ahora es bastante que le encargan. Otra integrante del grupo es la Blanca Rosa tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos menores de edad. La señora Blanca se dedica a la venta de artículos varios como frutas, gaseosas, golosinas, cosméticos, etc. Cabe señalarse, este negocio dio inicio desde hace mas de 20 años con poco inventario, poco a poco ha ido incrementando su capital hasta llegar a vender frutas y verduras en la cual necesita tener suficiente dinero para comprar una cosecha y trasladarla al mercado para vender. Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en su negocio comprando frutas,  esto con el objetivo de ampliarlo y obtener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 30, is married and has three children, all of them minors. She works selling various products, that is, combs, glue, earrings, hair clips,  etc. She has had this business for more than five years and sells door to door in the departments of Managua, Carazo, Rivas, Masaya and Granada. It is worth mentioning that she started the business using her own resources, selling in the street out of a bag. She began the business out of the necessity of supporting her children. She is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of more cosmetics and other items for her customers as there are quite a few now who buy from her.  

Another member of the group is Blanca Rosa, 51, who is married and has four children, two of them minors. Blanca works selling various items such as fruit, soft drinks, candy, cosmetics, etc. It bears mentioning that this business had its beginning more than 20 years ago with minimal inventory. Little by little she has added to her capital to the point at which now she sells fruits and vegetables for which she requires sufficient money to be able to buy a harvest and transport it to market for sale. She is seeking this loan to invest in her business by buying fruit in order to grow her business and obtain more financial income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan. In this photo she is holding a book, called an Asasah passbook. She is 35 years old has lived with her family in a three-room brick house for over 12 years. Kalsoom has five sons, but only two of them are in school due to the financial state of Kalsoom and her husband, who works in the field and grows different crops. 

Kalsoom supports her husband financially by selling clothes. She buys clothes from Lahore and sells them to her local market to make a profit. She has been doing this work for over five years. Kalsoom has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to expand her clothing business. With the loan money she will buy bulk quantity clothes of different varieties. This variety will increase her sales because her customers will have more choice. 

This is Kalsoom’s second loan from Asasah. She built good credit during the previous loan year and has never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en: Jenifa M.  is currently in the business of selling fish, green vegetables and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and Jerry cans of cooking oil to sell.  Jenifa is 39 years old and is married with a husband that is a farmer . She has 3 children and only one child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more fish and jerry cans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno,  departamento  de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene cinco  hijos.  Pudo estudiar hasta la secundaria.
Leonor, está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de gaseosas y golosinas.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo monto de S/ 600.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizará para comprar golosinas y gaseosas de varios sabores.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son los préstamos y la solidaridad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago Apóstol" located in the district of Paucarcolla, province and department of Puno. She is 40 years of age, living in a committed relationship and has five children. She was able to study through middle school. 

Leonor has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years. She requested her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles to invest in her soft drink and candy sales business. 

Now she will request a new loan in the amount of 600.00 nuevos soles which will be used for purchasing candy and soft drinks of various flavors. Her dream is to continue on in her business and generate a greater income. 

What she likes the most about the Communal Bank are the loans and the mutual support among the members.

loans.use: To purchase candy and soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  fruit vending and buying & selling of copra. She lives in Prk. Linao, Brgy. Ipilan, Brookes Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 37712 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.   By working hard in her fruit vending and buying & selling of Copra businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.  

Emma  is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her banana and copra business.  This will be her 22nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Emma  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations of banana & copra business

loans.name: Marrisa

texts.en:
Marrisa E. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Marrisa is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Marrisa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Marrisa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marrisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marrisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marrisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & biscuits. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marrisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk food & biscuits

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Christine has a business selling spare parts, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to get a good job. Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her how to interact with people.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a plot of land to dig dirt for sale

loans.name: Kashunju

texts.en: Kashunju S. is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 32 years old and married with three children. S. has a timber sales business in Bonoga trading centre — a business he has managed for over two years. He is able to make 40,000/= as weekly profits dealing mostly with locals who are his loyal customers. He also owns a motorcycle that he rides sometimes for business and this contributes to his income. He started his business using his savings from the Saving and Credit organizations. He describes himself as an achiever and hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: Buying more timber for his lumber workshop.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Don Juan Francisco habitante de Nueva Guinea,  su familia esta conformada por su Esposa y un hijo, desde hace 17 años labora como docente para el Ministerio de Educacion brindando enseñanza a niños y jovenes, siendo su  principal actividad que le genera ingreso para sastifacer sus necesidades y mejorar su calidad de vida.

nesecita este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construccion, para realizarle el piso a su casa de habitacion y asi poder vivir en mejores condiciones,  lo cual espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño.  

Pues su objetivo es mejorar su vivienda y darles lo mejor a su Familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Francisco lives in Nueva Guinea.  His family is comprised of his wife and a son.  For 17 years he has been working for the Ministry of Education as a teacher to children and adolescents.  He is the main source of income for household expenses and improving quality of life.

He is in need of a loan to buy construction materials to add a second level onto his home in order to improve living conditions.  He hopes to receive help from KIVA so he can carry out his dream, which is to improve his home and give his family the best he can.

loans.use: To add a second level to his house

loans.name: Kansenene Group

texts.en: John is a member of Kansenene United Traders where each member guarantees the others' loans. He needs a loan to purchase fresh food such as irish and sweet potatoes to sell. He lives in Fort Portal Uganda and is married with eight children. The youngest is 15 years old. John has been dealing in fresh foods for two years and has already grown his profits. His future plan is to set up at least six stalls in different markets.

loans.use: Purchase fresh produce for sale.

loans.name: Beverlie

texts.en: Beverlie is a married woman who lives in the island of Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Angelo, who is 57 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  Beverlie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Beverlie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,700, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy groceries items to resell so that she can continue to save up for future house repair. Beverlie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia S. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Alia owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Alia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Alia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional bananas and to increase working capital. Alia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional green bananas. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Doña Ana H. P., es casada, tiene 45 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a una escuela, tiene 3 hijos 2 D. los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a oficios domestico y a la crianza D. animales, lleva 12 años D. experiencia con este oficio, inició este oficio por iniciativa propia y deseos D. superación; cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la confección D. tejidos.

DeciD. organizar un grupo con el objeto D. solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR, que servirá como capital para comprar cerdos y gallinas para crianza, para que cuando han crecido los revenda a mayor costo. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas activdades como: Venta D. ropa deportiva, venta D. ropa típica, atender tienda D. consumo diario, confección D. pants, sudaderos y playeras, y la crianza D. animales doméstiC.. Esperan ver su negocio granD. y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana H. P. is a 45-year-old married woman who never had the opportunity to go to school. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She has been working as a housekeeper and raising animals for 12 years now. Ana began working of her own initiative because she wanted to improve her situation. She has the support of her husband, who makes fabric for a living.

Ana decided to organize a group in order to request a loan from ASDIR. This loan will allow the group to buy pigs and chickens which they will raise and then sell for a higher price once they are fully grown. The members of this group have different kinds of jobs including: selling sportswear, selling traditional clothing, working in a store which sells basic goods, making pants, sweatshirts and shoes, and raising pets. They would like to grow their business and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is a 26-year-old hard-working young woman. She lives with her mother, husband and two children, aged 5 and 1, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer 'ger' districts of the city. Her son attends kindergarten while her mother is retired and stays at home with Lhagvasuren’s daughter.

Lhagvasuren started her business in 2008 by selling firewood at Tsaiz, Mongolia’s biggest raw materials outdoor market, with help from her husband. As a result of their hard work, today, they have working capital of 7,100,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) and equipment of 3,000,000 MNT. They buy raw materials from the wood truck which comes from the countryside and then they cut the wood using a cutting machine to sell as firewood.

Lhagvasuren is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy wood this season as the price will be lower compared to summer. Therefore she can buy wood at a low price and produce firewood to sell at a higher price in the summer. Lhagvasuren wants her children to get an excellent education and her goal is to build a new small house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more wood.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary currently sells groundnuts and simsim (sesame). She is 30 years old and married. She took out a loan to stock more groundnuts and simsim to sell. She hopes to open a shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more groundnuts and simsim (sesame) to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 58 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells slippers and shoes. She has had this business for 15 years. Lilian's spouse raises hogs. Lilian is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more shoes and slippers in different sizes including sandals to offer. Each month, Lilian earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. 

In the future, Lilian hopes to have a big business in order to generate more income that would help to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes, slippers and sandals to sell

loans.name: Akwata Empola Development Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Florence's decade-long dairy business is what she has depended on to provide better support for her family of six. Milk is in high demand in many parts of Jinja.

Florence herds her own cattle, which is an asset in this business. She says by virtue of the fact that she has her own cows, she in most cases is able to handle the demands of clients.

This business generates Florence an income of 70,000 UGX weekly. She says this loan is to help her purchase another heifer.

loans.use: to purchase another heifer.

loans.name: Santos Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Santos Elvira es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 48 años. Ella se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y tiene una carnicería la cual inicio su esposo y cuando empezó a trabajar ella quedo a cargo. 
Santos con el crédito comprara de carne y cosméticos y su meta es tener una moto para ir a vender a Veracruz, Inca, Nindiri…etc. y otros lugares.
Ella tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad y quien la acompaña es su pequeña nieta de tres años.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Elvira is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who is 48 years old.  She works in cosmetics and has a butcher business which her husband began; when she started working there she took charge.

With the loan, she will purchase meat and cosmetics, and her goal is to be able to have a motorbike with which to go and sell in Veracruz, Inca, Nindiri, etc., and elsewhere.

She has four grown children and also a little granddaughter who is three years old.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en: Serina is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 47 years old and married to Philip, also a farmer, and they have five children. She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use the part of the loan amount to buy farm isupplies like seeds and fertilizer. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kambeng est créé le même jour que le Banc Villageois. Ses membres 09 membres qui le composent habitent le même quartier et ont pour activité principale le commerce. 

Mme Gnima, à droite de la photo avec la main droite levée, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants à charge.

Elle pratique le commerce de poissons frais depuis plus de 10 ans avec une grande expérience.

Ce prêt lui permettra de faire plus de bénéfice qu'avant et elle pourra renforcer son épargne. 

Les profits lui permettront d'assurer la prise en charge de ses enfants pour la nourriture, la santé et aussi la scolarité.
texts.en:
Le groupe Kambeng est créé le même jour que le Banc Villageois. Ses membres 09 membres qui le composent habitent le même quartier et ont pour activité principale le commerce. 

Mme Gnima, à droite de la photo avec la main droite levée, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants à charge.

Elle pratique le commerce de poissons frais depuis plus de 10 ans avec une grande expérience.

Ce prêt lui permettra de faire plus de bénéfice qu'avant et elle pourra renforcer son épargne. 

Les profits lui permettront d'assurer la prise en charge de ses enfants pour la nourriture, la santé et aussi la scolarité.

loans.use: Acheter des caisses de poissons frais

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 37 years old, married to Fidelis, and blessed with three children.
Thomas hawks tea leaves, soya, coffee and many other products. He has been in this business for the last seven years and earns an income of 14,500 KES per month. He is applying for his third loan, of 20,000 KES, from Kiva partner, KADET, with which he plans to buy tea leaves, soya and coffee and pay for packaging expenses and other expenses. Thomas will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. In the future, he hopes to start a manufacturing business for said items, packaging them and becoming a wholesale distributor.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, soya, coffee and other goods.

loans.name: Joseline Patricia

texts.es:
Joseline, está soltera, vive con sus padres, ella estudia en la universidad, se auto financia los gastos universitarios con una iniciativa, vendiendo lociones y cosméticos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 años, atiende el negocio de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de lociones de diferentes marcas, las que son ofrecidas en las revistas como AVON, ESIKA, también comprara maquillajes, sombras, rubor, para ofrecer a los clientes, y esta inversión le permita tener mejores ganancias.
El sueño de Joseline es terminar sus estudios Universitarios, poder superarse no solo académicamente sino que también en el negocio, ayudando a sus padres en lo más posible.
texts.en:
Joseline is single and lives with her parents. She is a university student, and self-finances her university expenses through her business selling lotions and cosmetics.  She has had this business for 6 years, and works at it from 7:00am to 4:00pm.  

She will use the loan to buy different brands of lotions; the ones that are featured in magazines like Avon and Esika.  She will also buy make-up, eye shadows, and blush to sell to her customers. This investment will allow her to improve her earnings.  

Joseline's dream is to complete her university studies and to excel not only academically, but also in business; helping her parents as much as possible.

loans.use: To buy make-up, eye shadow, blush. and different brands of lotions.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora  Virginia tiene la edad de 60 años, estudio la primaria, esta casada con el señor Ciro que se encuentra pensionado, ellos tuvieron 2 hijos los cuales ya se enceuntran casados.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace un poco mas de 5 años decidio iniciar su propio negocio de venta de tamales y antojitos mexicanos porque quere que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña Virgia realiza sus ventas desde la comodidad de su casa, los dias viernes vende antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tacos dorados, garnachas, gorditas, platanos) y llegan sus vecinos y amigos a comprarle, tambien dice que los dias Jueves vende tamales levanta los pedidos un dia antes y al dia siguiente los entrega y asi dia a dia va teniendo mas popularidad con las personas de su comunidad.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de masa, hojas de platano, variedad de chiles, carne de res y de pollo, tomate, cebolla, col, tortillas, queso, aceite, platos desechables, frijol para posteriormente la preparacion de sus alimentos.

Doña Virginia espera que con este credito su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia is 60 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is married to Sr. Ciro, who is a pensioner.  They have two children who are already married.  

Virginia says that a little more than five years ago, she decided to start her own business selling tamales and Mexican street food because she wanted her family to have a better quality of life.

Doña Virginia conducts her sales from the comfort of her home.  On Fridays she sells Mexican street food such as empanadas, hard tacos, “garnachas” (tortillas topped with shredded meat, cheese, and cabbage), gorditas, and plantains.  Her neighbors and friends come to buy her food.  Virginia says that on Thursdays she sells tamales based on the orders she received the day before.  With each passing day, she gains more popularity with the people in her community.  

She needs this loan to buy corn meal, banana leaves, various chili peppers, beef, chicken, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, tortillas, cheese, oil, disposable plates, and beans for preparing her foods.  

Doña Virginia hopes that this loan will prosper her business.

loans.use: to buy corn meal, banana leaves, various chili peppers, beef, chicken, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, tortillas, cheese, oil, disposable plates, and beans.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 27 años de edad, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y su querida hija Keyli de 11 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Yobana tuvo una infancia sacrificada de la cual tuvo que salir adelante a base de perseverancia. A sus 18 años se independizó. Dejó de ser empleada y abrió su propio negocio que es una tienda de abarrotes, empezó vendiendo sus productos en las calle de manera ambulatoria y con el transcurso del tiempo y con la ayuda de unos ahorros compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se sitúa su bodega. Ella es una mujer de armas tomar y señala que uno logra su propósitos con mucho esfuerzo y tenacidad.  Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano. Con las ganancias adquiridas compró su propia chacra de 02 hectáreas donde trabaja su esposo. Yobana necesita el crédito para seguir prosperando y prestando buen servicio a sus consumidores. Este será su sexto crédito con MFP y ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos anteriores y espera comprar lo que necesita. Necesita comprar mostradores y mesas para exhibir con mayor estética su mercadería.
texts.en: Yobana, who was born in Santa Rosa, is 27 years old. She is a sensible and hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her partner and their much loved daughter, 11 year old Keyli, who is Yobana's motivation for everything she does. Yobana had a deprived childhood which she managed to overcome with perseverance. By the age of 18 she was caring for herself independently. She left her job and started her own business - a grocery store - by selling her products while walking the streets. As time passed, and using what little savings she had, she managed to buy her own plot of land where her store is now located. She is not a woman to be reckoned with; that is to say, she is the kind of person who achieves her objectives through great effort and tenacity. These days she is happy with her business activities, her great charisma and her kindness in all her dealings. She has become a favourite with her neighbours, who have been her loyal clients since the early days of her business. Her profits have been used to buy her own 2 hec. farm where her husband now works. Yobana needs this loan to continue earning and providing a good service to her customers. This will be her sixth loan with MFP and she has repaid her previous loans on time. She hopes to be able to buy the items she needs: cabinets and tables to display her stock stylishly.

loans.use: To buy tables and display counters.

loans.name: Oltiboi

texts.ru: Олтибой женат и у них 1 ребенок. Он трудолюбивый, умный и целеустремленный человек.  Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он имеет 23, 81 гектар земли и там выращивает семечки, овощи и пшеницу. А также он имеет сады абрикоса, сливу и айвы. Более 8 лет он успешно продолжает данный бизнес и у него очень хороший опыт в этом бизнесе. Олтибой хотел бы получить займ для покупки семена и минеральных удобрений для переработки земли.
texts.en: Oltiboi is married and is a father of a child. He is a hardworking, smart and goal oriented man. Oltiboi is a farmer. He owns a large plot of land (~60 acres) and grows sunflower seeds, vegetables and wheat there. He also has apricot, plum and quince orchards. For more then 8 years Oltiboi has been running his produce farm and he has a lot of experience in agriculture. Oltiboi is planning to use this loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer to improve his soil.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Eva

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y dos nietos 5 y 8 años de edad, ademas de una hermana, ella tiene un taller costura (vestidos, faldas, blusas, lo inicio hace 18 años,lo heredo de sus padres, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales de costura (Telas, agujas, botones, alfileres), de esa forma tendrá lo necesario para poder trabajar y entregar a tiempo las costuras a sus clientes, dando un buena imagen de su trabajo, y ganando mas clientela.
El sueño de Ana, es cada día mejorar sus ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband, two grandchildren ages 5 and 8, and a sister. She has a tailoring workshop (dresses, skirts, blouses). She started it 18 years ago, after inheriting the business from her parents. She works from Monday to Sunday. 

She needs the loan to buy tailoring materials (fabric, needles, buttons, pins). This way, she will have what she needs to work, and deliver sewing projects to her customers on time; enhancing her reputation as a tailor, and winning her more customers. 

Ana's dream is to improve her earnings each day, and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fabric, needles, buttons, and pins.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She sells farm fertilizer, animal feed, and provides veterinary services. She has seven years of experience in this business, and has employed two people.  She also does horticultural farming to supplement her income. Beatrice joined Faulu Kenya in order to access business loans easily. She has also gained a lot of knowledge on business management skills.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
De apariencia débil pero de personalidad segura y emprendedora, Norma de 40 años vive casada con Héctor de 48 años con quién tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con 4. Todos ellos habitan un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini.

Norma trabaja la tierra desde niña sembrando café, plata y achiote, productos que le han dado a ella y a su familia el sustento necesario hasta el momento; ya que cuentan con 2 parcelas y media de terreno, priorizando la plantación de café. Por su parte, Héctor su esposo se dedica de lleno a la agricultura, mientras ella trabaja en una embolsadora de café, en donde recibe un sueldo mensual, de esa manera percibe más ingresos. Y como si fuera poco, Norma vende los domingos vende comida en su casa. “A pesar de ser pequeñas, de mis parcelas obtengo 3 sacos de café y cada uno tiene 120 kilos, los vendemos por latas, cada lata pesa 2 kilos y su precio por ahora es de 6 soles, hay meses que se vende al doble, si nos conviene”, explica Norma. Mas adelante, ella quisiera verse morar en un hogar con más comodidades y de infraestructura más concisa y duradera, por ejemplo instalar un servicio de desagüe y colocar un lavadero, como prioridad, para eso seguirá trabajando como ahora. Con su ayuda, Norma podrá obtener su crédito número 4 de MFP, por lo que ella asegura pagará puntualmente cada mes, como lo estaba haciendo, junto a los demás integrantes de su banco comunal del que se siente tranquila, por que todos colaboran y saben organizarse.
