Once given this loan, she hopes to invest in the purchase of foodstuffs mainly beans, rice, peas, Irish potatoes, etc.  With this additional business, Emerence will hopefully earn more profit which in turn will allow her to increase her capital.  Once her capital is increased, she will keep reinvesting in her business for a better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: a variety of foodstuffs

loans.name: Flor Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Flor; tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera, ella trabaja en la realización de bordados en estandartes, detentes, banderas, recordatorios y todo con hilos de bronce, dorados y plateados; La socia es una mujer muy dulce y emprendedora ella con su modesto trabajo y muy arduo por ser a mano, logra ahorrar para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos en la educación superior, ella desea estudiar diseño grafico. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio.

 La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Perlas” (The Pearls), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 24 years old and single. Flor earns her living by making embroidered banners, religious ornaments, pennants, souvenirs, and other items using bronze, gold, and silver thread. She is an extremely sweet woman who is enterprising with her modest business. As a result of her hard work making handmade products, Flor has been able to save so that she can help her parents and pay the college expenses of her siblings. She wants to study graphic design and is requesting a loan to buy materials for her business.

Flor appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is a widow who lives in Prk. Esmeralda, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and selling fish. 

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 11500, to use to pay for more  fingerlings to stock in her ponds so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business and buy a new motor boat. Erlinda A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy K. is from the village of Macabibo Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. He is 51 years old. Rudy is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rudy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish, crabs, seaweed and shrimp in the local community. Rudy has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rudy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rudy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Stephen Barasa

texts.en:
Stephen is 44 years old, married to Mary Awino and they have 3 children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 63,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorbike.

In the future, Stephen hopes to diversify and open up a retail shop that will be operated by his wife.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Suluu's Group

texts.en:
Suluu J., the leader of the group, is 47 and married. She and her husband, who raises money by working as a private builder (his salary comes to 5000 soms per month), have two children, a daughter who is a student of the university in the city of Osh, and a son who works in Russia. Suluu and her daughter sell milk (10 liters daily ) and eggs. The loan's purpose is to allow them to complete the building of their house. In the future the family plans to arrange the children’s weddings and then develop a cattle-breeding business,

Suluu’s partners:

Erkingul A., the treasurer of the group, is 51, married, and the mother of four grown children. The family's main income derives from selling milk and eggs. The loan's purpose is to purchase poultry and cattle for fattening and breeding.

Maksudahan M., 47, is a widowed mother of three children. The family sells milk, and the loan's purpose is to purchase a cow for fattening and breeding.

Kanaatbek A., 35, is a married father of three small sons. Kanaatbek supports his family financially by cattle breeding and cattle sales. He also sells automobiles. The loan's purpose is to purchase cattle and fodder.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To finish building a house

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a teenage son. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo where she sells children’s clothing in the local market called “Image”.

Irina is very customer-friendly and polite with all of her clients. She has been in this business for six years. Currently, Irina has 25,000 UAH in inventory and her profit amounts to about $790 a month.

Irina is requesting a 4,000 UAH loan to purchase additional merchandise. Her business is constantly growing and she can hardly handle the high demand she’s facing now. She realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business, as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is 21 years old and single. She works as a front office assistant at Early Bird Academy. She also operates a motorcycle transport business, which is locally known as "boda boda". Polly has employed a motorbike rider to operate the business. Polly has been in this business for the last two years and hence, acquired the relevant skills.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, and intends to buy another motorbike. Her salary will be used to take care of food and other basic needs. She is hopeful to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Emelita's Group

texts.en:
Emelita M. is from the village of Enrile. She is 29 years old. Emelita is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Emelita M..

Emelita is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector providing motorcycle transport services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a tricycle transport service. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Jane Muthoni

texts.en:
Jane Muthoni K. is 40 years old and married to Daniel. They have two children. For the past 11 years, Jane has been operating a restaurant in Githurai 45 from which she earns a monthly profit of 35,000 KES. 

Jane is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to purchase food stock as well as buy a few tables and chairs to increase her cash flow. This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to save her profit from the loan to purchase a plot of land and build a hotel. In the future, Jane dreams of owning a big hotel with a swimming pool and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase food stock and tables and chairs

loans.name: Ushuuda Group

texts.fr: Mishonya L.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Ushuuda, âgée de 60 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants.  Son conjoint est un chargé de crédit dans une coopérative de la place. Elle fait le petit commerce de divers (riz, plastics, souliers, etc.) au marché sectoriel de Katindo II.  Aussitôt fait le mariage, environs 35 ans, elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Vers 2008, elle bénéficia de premier  crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (1 sac de riz, dizaines des plastics, 10 paires souliers, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne construire confortablement une maison pour ses jeunes enfants et les  faire scolariser. La cliente Mishonya L.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Ushuuda est constitué de 34 membres.
texts.en: Mishonya L. is an entrepreneur, the president of the Ushuuda group, 60 years old, and the mother of 5 children.  Her spouse is a loan officer in a local cooperative.  She runs a small business selling diverse items (rice, plastics, shoes, etc.) at the sectoral market of Katindo II.  As soon as she was married, about 35 years ago, she began her business with her own funds, received from her husband.  Around 2008, she received her first loan of $50 from the IMF Hekima.  This new loan should allow her to stock up on new products (1 bag of rice, dozens of plastics, 10 pairs of shoes, etc.).  Moreover, her ambition is to comfortably build a house for her young children and have them educated.  The client, Mishonya L., thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor, who are excluded from classic banks.  The group Ushuuda is made up of 34 members.

loans.use: 1 bag of rice, a dozen plastics, 10 pairs of shoes, etc.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Walter Antonio G. S. él es trabajador activo de la empresa de Enacal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Operador de Pozo tiene  siete  años  de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Walter Antonio G. S. is an active employee of the Enacal Company in San Rafael del Sur where he has worked the past seven years as a well operator. He is currently married and has one child in school. Walter has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items so that that he can expand and make improvements to his house.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great help in improving the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand & improve his house

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima A. is from the village of Gotokan Diot, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a banana and copra (dried coconut) business, selling in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately $55 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Zosima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Zosima is requesting a new loan of 4,500 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Soem R., age 41, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, which is the best area for farming. Soem R. is a married woman who is devoted to her three children, one of whom is a student.  The other two are sewing workers in a factory.  Soem R. and her husband work together in the same business, as salt and potato traders in a mobile unit. The family typically generates revenue of US$8 each day, which helps them live a comfortable life. Soem R. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming.  She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: Jopeth Jay

texts.en:
Jopeth is a young farmer (21 years old), living in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is still single and is helping his family financially.

Jopeth is a farmer and pig-grower. He plants and harvests rice crops that he sells to the market. The pigs he grows are for fattening and sale. 

Jopeth desires his business to grow. He requested for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which he will use to purchase piglets, feed, and farm fertilizers. Jopeth is also saving for his future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50-year-old married man and the father of five children. He lives in Beirut, where he has owned a grocery store since 1987. He is devoted to serving his clients and they appreciate him very much. Ali's store is located in front of a school so his customers are mainly students, teachers and parents. He is a hardworking man trying to provide his children with the best education.

This is Ali's ninth cycle. He is requesting this loan from Al Majmoua to buy more products to boost his sales. In the future, he wishes to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Barbara; ella tiene 71 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de mates medicinales, ella prepara de diferentes hierbas y también se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde siembra maíz, papa y zanahoria y luego lo vende en Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar sus negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar hierbas medicinales y para comprar semillas para sus tierras de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Barbara is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Barbara is 71 years old, married, and has seven children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling medicinal infusions.  She prepares her infusions from different herbs and also farms.  She has a plot of land where she grows corn, potatoes and carrots which she sells in Urubamba.  Barbara would like to expand her businesses.  She is requesting this loan to buy medicinal herbs and to buy seeds for her farmland.

Barbara is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy medicinal herbs and to buy seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and resells scrap in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional scrap to sell.

Adelita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her scrap business for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and farming sugarcane.

Adelita aspires to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and lives with six family members. Two of the family members work. Hussein has had a shop to sell mobile and phone accessories since 2006. He has four years of experience.  He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3,000 to buy a split air conditioner and a photocopier machine.  He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner and a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Emmy is a 32-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in photography for 12 years. He started with a salon and saved enough to start his current business. His hardship is fraudulent workers, and his vision is a bigger studio with a printing machine, plus educating his children. Emmy intends to use the loan to buy wedding gowns and a camera.

loans.use: to buy wedding gowns and a camera.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 48 years old and married with two children. He works as a motorcycle taxi driver and has done so for 22 years. His wife earns money by selling fried potatoes on T. street. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He intends to take a loan to buy a new fuel-saving motorcycle that will help him to reduce expenses and get more customers. 

He hopes that this will increase his income and enable him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new fuel-saving motorcycle

loans.name: Emérita

texts.es: Emérita de 54 años de edad vive en el barrio San Salvador de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  en compañía de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 21 y 33.  Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía especialmente ropa, bolsos, accesorios sabanas y jeans, que inició hace 6 años, cuando tomó un ahorro para comprar productos y venderlos a crédito otorgando los plazos acordados con sus clientes. A Emérita le ha ido muy bien con su negocio, ella con sus utilidades logró construir dos apartamentos,  que ahora forman parte de sus ingresos pues se encuentran en calidad de arrendamiento. En su cartera maneja aproximadamente 200 clientes fijos y cada día se esmera por encontrar nuevos y rentables,  que le apoyen el crecimiento de sus ingresos.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el  comprará en mayor cuantía y de contado, bolsos, accesorios y diversificará con prendas de plata, mercancías  que son muy rentables y ya tiene un pedido importante. Su meta más adelante es tener un nuevo  vehículo, por eso se esmera por aumentar cada día mas su rentabilidad que es no menor del 51%
texts.en: Emérita is 54 years old and lives in the San Salvador neighborhood in the city of Baranquilla. She lives with her husband and they have two children who are 21 and 33 years old. She sells merchandise, especially clothing, bags, accessories, sheets and jeans. Six years ago, she started by using savings to buy products that she then sold on credit, offering her customers agreed-upon terms of repayment. Emérita's business has been doing very well. With her profits, she has managed to build two apartments that are now part of her income because she rents them out. She has approximately 200 regular clients in her portfolio, and each day she strives to find new and profitable ones to support the growth of her income. This "credikiva" is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy greater quantities and to pay cash for bags and accessories, as well as to diversify with silver pieces. These are are a very profitable type of merchandise for which she already has an important order. Her furthest goal is to have a new vehicle, which is why she strives each day to improve her profitability, which is never less than 51%.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities and to pay cash for bags and accessories, as well as to diversify with silver pieces

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Cleofe has a retail shop that sells vegetables like cabbages & carrots. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of vegetables.

Cleofe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cleofe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bertha Patricia

texts.es:
Bertha Patricia tiene 30 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos de 8 años y 3 meses, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Bertha se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es tener capital para comprar una casa y estabilidad economica.

Le gusta cuidar a los hijos y conversar con el esposo.
texts.en:
Bertha Patricia is 30 years old.  She is married and lives with her two husband and two children, ages 8 years and 3 months, in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.  

The El Niño Divino (the Divine Child) Rural Communal Bank is located in the Estero Lindo precinct, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas.  The members are farmers who cultivate short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Bertha makes her living in agriculture and cultivates corn and rice.  She buys her supplies from AGRIPAC (a company that engages in the import, distribution, and sale of agro-industry inputs in Ecuador) and sells her produce at the Ventanas wholesale market.

She is requesting this loan to plant corn and rice and to buy seeds and fertilizer for the corn and rice.  The support of this loan would help her financially to buy the supplies she needs.  She faces challenges such as crop pests and the lack of money to pay more workers.  Her dream is to have the capital to buy a house and to have financial stability.  

She enjoys taking care of her children and talking with her husband.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for corn and rice.

loans.name: Krouch

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators. One of them is Krouch, who has been working in this sector since 2005. 

She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business, they can generate an income of around US $4 per day. 

This humble couple has two children who are students. This growing-rice season, the family planted rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this condition, Krouch would like to borrow a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops' yield.

She took the photo at rented house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose Miguel es un señor de 69 años de edad, vecino de una comunidad rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Don Jose Miguel vive con su esposa e hijos.

Desde hace varios años que don Jose Miguel inició su negocio de siembra de café. El siembra  sus productos los cuales vende en su negocio a la hora de la cosecha. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente don Jose Miguel requiere un préstamo de ¢300.000 (trescientos mil colones) para la asistencia de su cafetal. Con esto espera agilizar y facilitar su trabajo.

Don Jose Miguel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose Miguel is a 69-year-old gentleman who is a resident of a rural community in Costa Rica called San Cristóbal Norte, which is situated 45 kilometers to the south of San José. San Cristóbal is a slightly mountainous area that has developed business activities such as retail, vegetable and coffee farming, handicrafts, livestock breeding, and others. Don Jose Miguel lives with his wife and children.

Several years ago, Don Jose Miguel started a business growing coffee. He grows his product and then sells it upon harvest. His micro-enterprise has helped to improve the conditions of his family considerably. He says that the success of his business is based on providing good service to people and meeting their demands.

At the moment, Don Jose Miguel needs a loan of 300,000 CRC for growing coffee. With this money, he hopes to facilitate his work and make it more efficient.

Don Jose Miguel is a member of the San Cristóbal Norte Communal Credit Enterprise (SACRIN), which is one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Boniface Sirikwa

texts.en:
Boniface is a 27-year-old married man. He has 2 children, aged 1 and 5. He describes himself as a visionary man.

Boniface operates a retail store where he sells sugar, bread, soda, cooking oil and rice in a shopping centre. He has been in this business for 2 years.  Before this, he was involved in farming.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the low purchasing power of customers due to inflation.

Boniface will use his KES 30,000 loan to purchase rice and sugar to sell in his retail shop. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into wholesale. He would also like to buy a plot of land to put up rental houses within 5 years.

loans.use: buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 39 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre. Ella es madre soltera y a pesar de los constantes problemas que afronta está orgullosa de su hija María; ambas viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Desde muy temprano se levanta para poder preparar sus alimentos y enviar a estudiar a su hija, para luego dirigirse a cuidar y limpiar sus sembríos hasta altas horas de la noche, como dice "hasta que el cuerpo resista “. Son 29 años que ella se dedica a la siembra de papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja y flor de gladiolo, como toda una mujer de negocios Sonia también abrió una pequeña tienda, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Más delante ella desea incrementar sus ventas; con la compra de más semillas y sembrar en mayores cantidades; para poder venderlo a un mejor precio y darle una excelente calidad de vida a su hija, que es el motor de su progreso y trabajo. Cuenta que dentro de algunos meses cosechará la flor de gladiolo que sembró. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde está agradecida por la seguridad que le brinda su banco comunal. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Sonia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales y si le sobra el dinero comprará productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
39-year-old Sonia is a tenacious and cheerful woman.  She is a single mother and, in spite of the constant problems that she faces, she is proud of her daughter María.  The pair live in their own home which is located in the small village of Patay.

Sonia gets up very early in the morning so that she can prepare her food and send her daughter off to school.  She then goes out to care for and weed her crops until late at night.  As she says "for as long as my body can withstand it".  Sonia has been growing potatoes (a Peruvian tuber), peas and gladioli flowers for 29 years.  Like the true businesswoman she is, Sonia also opened a small store where she sells basic household products.  In the future, she would like to increase her sales.  She would like to buy more seeds and grow crops in larger quantities.  This will enable her to sell at a better price and provide her daughter, who is the driving force behind her progress and work, with an excellent quality of life.  She tells us that in a few months time she will harvest the gladioli that she sowed.

Sonia belongs to the 'Virgen de Fátima' community bank and this is her tenth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the security which her community bank gives her.  For this reason, she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  With your support, Sonia will invest the money she has requested in buying two bags of pea seeds, several sacks of natural fertilizers and, if she has money left over, she will buy basic household products for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds, sacks of fertilizer, and products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick successfully paid back his previous loan in full, four months ahead of schedule. He's been approved for a larger loan of 40,000 KES to continue growing his business. With this loan, Patrick intends to purchase more spare parts to sell in his bicycle shop.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell in his bicycle shop

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, se ha decidido nuevamente por un prestamo, ya que esta iniciando el cultivo de maiz y frijol, en esta ocasion esta iniciando los preparativos para la tierra, necesita comprar abono y herbicidas, este como otros prestamos le han servido para contar con los insumos necesarios, y gracias a Dios ha logrado mantener buenas cosechas.
Esta contento con su trabajo y espera que este nuevo cultivo sea igual de provechoso. En la actualidad continua vendiendo pan y estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Orlando has decided, once again, to take out a loan, since he is beginning to cultivate corn and beans. At present, he has begun to prepare the land and needs to buy manure and herbicides. This loan, like his previous ones, will be used to buy necessary inputs. Thanks to God, he has been able to achieve good harvests.

Orlando is content with his work and hopes that this new planting will be equally successful. At present, he continues to sell bread and study in the university.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides for cultivating corn and beans.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад женат имеет двоих детей. Он занимается на протяжении четырнадцати лет товарами народного потребления. У него свой магазин. Товары он привозит изучая потребность населения. Доходы идут на расширение бизнеса и содержания семьи. Он хочет получить займ для пополнения магазина товарами к зиме и продуктами к праздникам. Он надеется получить займ.
texts.en: Abdusamad is married and has two children.  He has been involved in selling grocery products for fourteen years.  He owns a store and brings in products depending on residents' demand.  The earnings are used for business expansion and supporting his family.  Abdusamad wants to obtain this loan to refill store inventory with goods for the winter and products for the holidays.  He hopes to obtain this loan.

loans.use: to buy products for the winter holidays

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб родился в городе Душанбе в семье служащего. В 1997 году поступил в школу и отлично закончил ее в 2008 году. После окончания школы он поступил в Технологических Университет Таджикистана, в настоящее время является студентом третьего курса. Он активный и целеустремленный юноша, участвует во всех молодежный студенческих мероприятиях. Сухроб запрашивает займ для оплаты годового обучения. Сухроб заранее благодарит вас всех за вашу поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Suhrob was born in the city of Dushanbe, into a military family.  He started school in 1997 and finished it with excellence in 2008.  After finishing school, he was accepted to the Tajikistan Technology University, where he is currently a third-year student.  He is an active and goal-oriented young man, who participates in all of the youth student events.  Suhrob is requesting this loan to pay for one year of studies.  He thanks you in advance for your support and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single and has two children aged 2 and 9; they are in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been operating a roots (country gin) shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more roots and gins (country gin) for her business. With more profit and more customers, she hopes to support her children in earning a higher education.

loans.use: To purchase more roots and gins (country gin) for her business.

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es: La señora María Fabiola a sus 56 años de edad se dedica desde hace ocho años a su negocio, una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad de Medellín. La tienda inicialmente era de su esposo, quien falleció y por tanto la señora María Fabiola quedo con la responsabilidad de la tienda y de su familia. Con la tienda a sacado adelante a su familia. La señora María Fabiola desea comprar surtido como snakcs, dulces, galletas, aceite, café, entre otros productos, lo anterior le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos con los cuales pueda brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Fabiola, 56, has been in business for 8 years; she runs a store located in downtown Medellín.  The store initially was her husband’s but when he died María Fabiola was left with the responsibility of the store and her family.  The store has made it possible for her to support her family.  María Fabiola would like to buy more stock merchandise like snacks, candy, cookies, oil and coffee, among other products which will allow her to increase income to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sèho Vincent

texts.fr: Sèho Vincent est âgé de 54 ans et est marié à une agricultrice du nom de Estelle. Le couple a douze enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants en charge. Sèho Vincent vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Sèho Vincent n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Sèho Vincent mène comme activité depuis trente cinq ans environs, la culture des légumineuses (piment et patates douces) et des céréales (haricot et maïs) qu’il vend dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sèho Vincent fait l’élevage des bœufs. C'est dans sa région que Sèho Vincent exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Sèho Vincent sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les trois premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Sèho Vincent ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Sèho Vincent is 54 years old and is married to a farmer named Estelle. They have twelve children, some at school and all living at home. As well as their own children, they have three other dependent children. Sèho Vincent lives with his wife and children. Sèho Vincent did not attend school. The couple cover the family's expenses between them. In order to meet his own needs and those of the family, Sèho Vincent has, for approximately thirty five years, grown vegetables (peppers and sweet potatoes) and cereals (beans and corn) which he sells in a market in Benin. In addition to this activity, Sèho Vincent also raises cattle. He does all this in his local area. In order to strengthen his business, and to better meet his customers' needs, Sèho Vincent is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDé. His ambition is to increase the scale of his activity. The three loans previously taken by Sèho Vincent have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products for growing (corn, beans, peppers and sweet potatoes).

loans.name: Silvia Carmelina

texts.es:
Silvia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, por que la institución le ha ayudado con el otorgamiento de préstamos rápidos según su necesidad, en esta ocasión el préstamo será utilizado en la compra de mercadería como arroz, aceite, condimentos, pan, huevos y boquitas, galletas y dulces.
Ella considera que estor préstamos han mejorado el negocio y las condiciones de su familia, pues sus hijos han avanzado con un año más de estudio.
texts.en:
Silvia has decided to ask for a new loan, because the institution has helped her with quick loans according to her need. 

On this occasion the loan will be used to buy merchandise like rise, oil, condiments, bread, eggs, snacks, cookies and candies. She feels that the loans have improved both her business and her family, since her children have advanced another year in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, condiments, bread, eggs, snacks, cookies and sweets.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 29 years old. She is married with three children, ages between 1 and 4; none of them have attended school yet. Angelique has been running a business of selling maize flour and rice for 6 years. She has requested the loan to buy more maize flour and rice for sale. With the profits, Angelique will buy a motorcycle for transportation and it will be another source of generating income. She would love to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour and rice for sale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly de 27 años convive con Manaces, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 6 años. Toda esta familia vive unida bajo un techo propio en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Nelly está orgullosa con los resultados de sus esfuerzos y sacrificios. 
Ella y Manaces se dedican a al agricultura. Ellos saben que les conviene y como negociarlo. En todo este tiempo juntos aprendieron que el café y el achiote nunca deben faltar en sus terrenos de cultivo. Es así que cuentan con una parcela y media de café cultivado y otra parcela de achiote. Estas siembras están bien cuidadas y atendidas. “Hay días de duro trabajo, y las chacras están bien lejos, por eso contratamos personal, ahí se va casi todo nuestro capital”, menciona.
A pesar de eso, siempre les ha ido bien. Los días en que los precios bajan, son desfavorables, pero nunca llegaron a perder su inversión.
Los compradores ya conocen a Nelly y saben de calidad de sus productos por eso vende con facilidad sus productos, muchas veces en su propia comunidad. Espera iniciar más siembras adquiriendo más terrenos cultivables. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Nelly obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, del que se muestra entusiasmada.
De recibir el dinero, contratará el personal necesario para limpiar sus cultivos de café y achiote. Gastando por persona 30 soles, incluyendo la alimentación.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 27, lives with Manaces. They have 4 children, ages 13, 11, 9, and 6. This entire family lives together under their own roof in the native community of Pachacutec in the province of Chanchamayo. Nelly is proud of her efforts and sacrifices.

Nelly and Manaces are farmers. They know that farming suits them and how to carry out the business. In all their time together, they have learned that coffee and achiote never fail to grow on the land they cultivate. These plants are well cared for. “There are days of hard work, and the fields are far away. That’s why hiring labor takes almost all our capital,” she says. In spite of that they have always done well. Times when prices are low are unfavorable, but they have never lost on their investment. Buyers already know Nelly and know the quality of her products. That’s why she sells her products easily, often in her own community. She hopes to have more plants by acquiring more land.

This will be Nelly’s first loan with MFP. She feels excited about this. She is part of the “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” (Pachacutec Carnations) Communal Bank and shows a lot of enthusiasm for it. Upon receiving the money she will hire the personnel necessary to harvest her coffee and achiote crop, spending 30 soles per person, including meals.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 27-year-old man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has a university degree but he could not get a job so he opened a grocery store. He started his business with limited capital and income. Because he is alone and has no one to support him, he did his best to improve and expand his business in order to build his future.
Due to the current bad situation which Yemen faces, Marwan's business is making less profit and his customers are decreasing. Therefore, he is planning to bring new goods to his grocery store in order to keep his customers and improve his income.
Marwan has requested a youth loan of 150,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB in order to purchase goods such as biscuits, cakes, soft drinks, rice and canned foods. He hopes that this will enable him to continue running his business successfully and make the business more profitable. 
In the future, Marwan would like to get a job and get married.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies.

loans.name: Sena Seme Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENA SEME est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. Nathalie, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 61 ans est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Nathalie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Nathalie et son mari. Nathalie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Nathalie vend des tissus et des vivres par la technique de distribution depuis une trentaine d’années. Nathalie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Nathalie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENA SEME  un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des vivres.

loans.name: Damassene

texts.en: In his early years, Damassene always admired reading about successful entrepreneurs. One of those stories pushed him to be in control of his own future and fulfill his dream. Hence, Astapropre, his sewing business, was founded in 2000. Because clothing is one of the basic human needs, Damassene finds pleasure in what he is doing for a living while satisfying his customers. However, the lack of equipment has left the customers’ needs unmet. That is why a loan from Zafen will help the business buy electric sewing machines for better quality clothing and services to its potential customers.

loans.use: To buy 15 modern sewing machines for quicker and better quality products

loans.name: Mujeres Chacayense Group

texts.en:
In the municipality of San José Chacayá, located outside of the city of Sololá within the lush, forested mountains of Western Guatemala, a place characterized by distinct traditional dress and the language Maya Kaqchikel, 7 motivated women make up the “Mujeres Chacayenses” trust bank.  

This group includes mothers and businesswomen, some of whom are educated in primary or secondary school, and others who did not have access to that opportunity. Between 19 and 45 years of age, they reflect a diverse range of experiences and walks of life. The majority of the women are artisans, investing their credit in creating beautiful hüipiles, traditional local blouses. Many of the members also raise animals such as chickens and grow corn and potatoes to sell, as well. 

Yenifer, the 24-year-old group president, was able to study through 6th grade, and currently strives to provide a good life for her three children, ages 8, 7 and 3, on her own, as she is separated from her husband. Yenifer weaves and embroiders huipiles, traditional blouses of her area to order, and will use her loan to buy the materials she needs to continue production. Buying thread, fabric, and patterns, she will keep moving forward, fulfilling her dreams to expand her sales and improve the lives of her children.

In their second loan cycle at Friendship Bridge, the hard working “Mujeres Chacayenses” are happy to be part of Friendship Bridge and Kiva, taking advantage of the monthly educational workshops they have access to, in which they gain useful knowledge for the thriving of their businesses and families. Thank you, Kiva!

loans.use: to purchase many colors of thread and supplies to make typical blouses

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 48 years old and is married with 9 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marita has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through GDMPC in order to buy more charcoal to sell in the community.through this business Marita earn an income to sustained their daily needs and to send their children in school.


Marita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business more.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Yazgul

texts.en:
Yazgul was born in 1975. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar region, settled in Absheron region. 
This single girl borrowed a loan of $400 and bought sugar, tea and etc.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to be busy with sale of manufactured goods (light industry).
She has been engaged in this business for 7 years.

loans.use: To start selling of manufactured goods (light industry)

loans.name: Hasanbala

texts.en: Hasanbala was born in 1952 in Salyan region Yenikand village. He is married and has 3 children. Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought 2 meaty calves. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves. He wants to increase the number of his calves and to improve his income.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong S., 52 years old, lives with her husband and 10 children in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers growing crops on a piece of land and typically generate about $4/day in revenue. Therefore, two of her children work at a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the rest are attending school. Because of too many members in the family and the house is too narrow, which is so hard to afford, S. hopes the loan will help her to purchase wood to build a wider house for her family and to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her next cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertizer and seeds for her farm and to build a wider house for her entire family

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia Tinini, the mother of a 4-year old child, is single and a member of the Flor de la Canela community association; she operates a small grocery store that she managed to open with the help of Pro Mujer.

Previously, Teodocia worked at making and selling vicuna blankets, a business that supported her for almost 10 years and that was passed down to her by her family, her mother, mainly.

Currently, Teodocia manages her own small store and needs capital to set up a telephone call station, something that will eventually lead to her getting a house for herself and her son; the house that she rents now takes so much of her earnings that she can’t provide the things her little one needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodocia T., es madre de 1 niño de 4 años, soltera, y miembro de la asociación comunal Flor de la canela, se dedica a la atención de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, que logro abrir con la ayuda de Pro Mujer.

Anteriormente, Teodocia se dedicaba a la confección y venta de mantas de vicuña, negocio en el que se mantuvo casi por 10 años, y que era una herencia familiar, principalmente de su madre.

Actualmente Teodocia administra su pequeño almacén, pero necesita de capital para poder instalar una central de llamadas telefónicas, de esta manera ver la manera de conseguir una vivienda para ella y su hijo, ya que el alquiler de la casa donde vive, resta mucho sus ingresos y no permite brindar las comodidades necesarias a su pequeño.

loans.use: Teodocia manages her own small store and needs capital to set up a telephone call station, something that will eventually lead to her getting a house for herself and her son; the house that she rents now takes so much of her earnings that she can’t provide the things her little one needs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira C., mother of six, is married to a public servant. She is a member of an association called "Pajchani de Villa Tejada". She dedicates herself to the making and selling of tailored garments like blankets, sweaters, scarves, and others, which she sells at El Alto's fair in the summer. She does not own her own store; she wanders around to sell her items only two days of the week. The other days, she is occupied in making and sewing the articles. Currently, she works with her daughters. They've learned the trade well - they produce about 20 blankets per week and are able to sell everything they make. They have three machines that allow them to complete their projects on time to meet customers' demands.

Elvira needs the loan to be able to increase her inventory, so she will be prepared for year-end festivities, where she has considerable source of income. This is the only way she will be able to face the challenge of providing for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira C., esta casada con un servidor público, y madre de 6 hijos, es miembro de la asociación Pajchani de Villa Tejada, se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir tejidas a máquina, como ser mantas, chompas, chalinas, y otros, que vende en la feria 16 de Julio de El Alto. No posee un puesto propio, por lo que tiene que deambular para poder vender, sólo sale a vender dos días a la semana, los demás días los ocupa en la confección. Actualmente trabaja con sus hijas, ellas han aprendido bien el oficio, produciendo aproximadamente 20 mantas a la semana, y vendiendo todo lo producido. Posee tres máquinas que le permiten trabajar a tiempo completo para satisfacer la demanda existente.

Elvira precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, de esta forma preparar su negocio para las fiestas de fin de año, temporada que se considera de alta venta. Solo así podrá hacer frente a los gastos de estudio de sus 6 hijos.

loans.use: Elvira needs the capital to be able to increase her inventory, so she will be prepared for year-end festivities, where she gets a considerable source of income.  This is the only way she will be able to face the challenge of providing for her six children's education.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Mrs. Janet O. E. is 46 years old, married and has 4 children.  She sells frozen food, provisions and foodstuff.  She is from Mushin, Lagos State.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a refrigerator to enable her to store frozen food.  She has been in business since 2005 and she is currently a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina Marilu

texts.es:
Mrs. Alejandra is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado (Entrepreneuring Women of the Market). She works selling tamales (a typical dish of the region). Her business is located in front of the central market of Huaraz, Ancash department.

With this loan for S/. 300.00 (US$ 125 approx.), which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy 1 sack of corn flour, 1 box of eggs, and 1 barrel of olives.

Mrs. Alejandra is 40 years old; she is separated from her husband and has two children, one of whom is in college and her daughter helps her out in the business. Her income allows her to offer her children education.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado” de Huaraz, por las mañanas se dedica a la venta tamales (comida típica de la zona), su negocio está ubicado al frente del Mercado central de Huaraz, del Departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de harina de maíz, una caja de huevo y 1 barril de aceituna.

Ella tiene 40 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la universidad y su hija la apoya en el negocio. Sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying ingredients (Compra de insumos.)

loans.name: Esna Nicida

texts.es:
Esna belongs to the Virgen de la Natividad communal bank, situated in Jr. Alfonso Ugarte, Block 7 in the Calleria district in Ucayali. She is 40 years old, married and is the mother of 2 young girls. Her husband sells “brosthers” chickens. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 200, she decided to invest it in the buying and selling of groceries retail.

Currently, she has a stand where she sells groceries in the Bellavista market. She wakes up at 4 a.m. to start her responsibilities in the business and finishes at 6 p.m. She then heads home to tend to her daughters and rest for the following day.

With the loan of S/. 2,300, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase 3 cases of milk, 5 sacks of rice, 25 sausages, 10 boxes of chocolates, 10 cases of oil, 2 boxes of eggs, etc.

Esna is very happy because she started with very few products, and her business is currently stocked thanks to the support from Manuela Ramos and also the unconditional support from her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esna pertenece al banco comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cuadra 7, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijas menores de edad, su esposo se dedica a la venta de pollos brosthers. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 200 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la compra y venta de abarrotes al por menor.

En la actualidad cuenta con un puesto de venta de abarrotes en el mercado de Bellavista (puesto Nº 9). Se levanta a las 4.00 a.m. para iniciar sus actividades en el negocio y termina a las 6.00 p.m., luego se dirige a su hogar par atender a sus hijas y descansar para el día siguiente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 3 cajas de leche, 5 cajas de panteones, 5 sacos de arroz, 25 salchichas, 10 cajas de chocolates, 10 cajas de aceite, 2 cajas de huevos, etc.

Esna está muy contenta porque se inició con pocos productos y actualmente ha surtido su negocio gracias al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos y también al apoyo incondicional de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (milk, rice, sausages, chocolates, oil, eggs, etc.)

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum T., who is 56, is married with six children and works with her husband on her rice paddy growing rice and vegetables. They have more than ten years of experience in cultivating crops. One of their children is employed by a garment factory; another one works for a private company as a driver; two others are unemployed and the rest of their children are married and live outside the family home. Mrs. Chum T. hopes to use this loan to purchase farming supplies including fertilizers, pesticide, and seeds to enable her to keep up her cultivations’ outputs. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Chum T. is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase her farm supplies.

loans.name: Alberta's Group

texts.es:
Zenaida, Rita and Alberta are members of the "Amauta Huamanga Community Bank" since 4, 4, and 8 months, respectively.

Zenaida is 44 years old; she is married and has 7 children. She is a street vendor and sells different types of products depending on seasonal demand. For instance, she sells school supplies during the school year and toys during Christmas.

Rital is 23 years old; she is married and has 3 children. Rita sells sandals at a shop, in the Grau market. She buys the sandals in the city of Lima and transports them to Ayacucho.

Alberta is 41 years old; she lives together with her couple and has 2 children. Alberta sells ceviche (form of citrus marinated seafood salad) but would like to stop this activity in order to sell clothes like school uniforms.

Zenaida, Rita and Alberta are asking for loans of 1000 soles (360USD) each. They will use them to buy pencils, colored pencils, crayons, sandals and uniforms.

Zeneida dreams of having her own stand to sell her products. Rita would like to study a profession and expand her business and Alberta would like to have a grocery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenaida, Rita y Alberta pertenecen al Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga hace 4, 4, 8 meses respectivamente.

Zenaida es casada, tiene 44 años y 7 hijos, Zenaida vende diferentes productos dependiendo de la demanda como útiles escolares en campaña escolar, juguetes en navidad, sus ventas lo realiza ambulantemente caminando.

Por otro lado Rita es casada, tiene 23 años y 3 hijos, Rita vende sandalias en un puesto del mercado Grau, sus productos lo trae de la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Alberta es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Alberta vende cebiche, actividad que dejará de realizar porque tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de ropa.

Zenaida, Rita y Alberta necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de lapiceros, pintura, plumones, sandalias, uniformes.

Los sueños de Zenaida, Rita y Alberta son establecer su negocio en un local, estudiar una carrera, ampliar su negocio, tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Zenaida, Rita and Alberta request 360USD each; they will buy pencils, colored pencils, crayons, sandals and uniforms.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 47 year old mother of 4 children. She works and lives in Aley, Lebanon. Mona is the owner of a locA. embroidery business, and will use the loan to buy materials and develop her business. She is a reliable entrepreneur, having already paid back a loan before.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi T. is 43 and married. He buys and sells general foodstuffs such as tomatoes, canned goods, rice, oil, sugar and milk. His store is located in Adéta, a town approximately 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this third loan from FECECAV, he would like to increase supplies for his store and thus better meet his family’s needs thanks to the profit he will earn from selling these goods.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Koffi T. est âgé de 43 ans et marié. Il est spécialisé dans l’achat et la vente des produits d’alimentation générale que sont les tomates, les boîtes de conserve, le riz, l’huile, le sucre, et du lait. Sa boutique est localisée à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, il souhaite augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en stock de marchandises et par là participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for his business

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía is a humble woman who works on the farm daily to make a living for her beloved family. She has devoted herself to this cause for awhile and gradually has improved her products and processes. Now that she has gained enough experience, she wishes to increase her orders and improve the quality and quantity of her products. For this reason , she has decided to apply for a loan to launch her project.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

LUCIA, es una humilde mujer que labra la tierra a diario y obtiene de ella el sustento para su amada familia. Se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo y poco a poco ha ido mejorando sus productos y procesos. Ahora que ha obtenido experiencia suficiente desea incrementar sus pedidos y mejorar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos. Por esa razón ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para poner en marcha su proyecto.

loans.use: Capital to launch her farming project

loans.name: Silper

texts.en:
Silper is a 45 year old married mother of 8 childen, four of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Nyalenda Kisumu, Kenya. She is the proprietor of five businesses, all supported by KMET and Kiva partnerships. She has received and fully paid four microfinance loans from KMET. She is currently applying for US $800 to strengthen her cereals and retail shop businesses.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To strengthen her cereal and retail shop businesses.

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi T., 31 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2003. With a starting fund of 80 USD, she invested in raising animals. However, it was not very profitable. Therefore, she decided to invest in selling beverages. Her husband, beside being a taxi driver, also helps her in her business. With an average income of 200 USD/month, she is now able to send her children to school and improve living conditions. This time, she wants to borrow 1100 USD to buy more beverages to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

 Chị Đặng Thị Tuyền năm nay 31 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Với số vốn vay ban đầu là 1.000.000đ chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng hiệu quả đem lại không cao vì thế vòng vốn sau chị đã quyết định đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh nước giải khát. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian đi làm nghề lái xe cũng phụ giúp chị trong kinh doanh nên công việc của chị rất thuận lợi. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị đã có điều kiện để đầu tư cho các con ăn học và cải thiện cuộc sống,. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay18.000.000đ để đau tư mua thêm hàng về bán.

loans.use: Business in beverages

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih A., 33 and married with five children, lives in the southern suburbs of Beirut, where he manufactures shoes. Rabih needs to buy a new supply of leather and other materials for his business, and is therefore requesting a loan of $1200 for that purpose. This is the second time Rabih will have received a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a large inventory of materials for Rabih's shoe-making business

loans.name: Iftihar

texts.en: Iftihar N. is 24 years old, single, and went into business for himself right after finishing secondary school because his family could not afford to send him to university. His main goal now is to help his parents financially. Since 2003, he has been selling cell phones. Business is very good, and Iftihar needs to increase his inventory of phones to meet the needs of his clients. To do this, he is applying for a loan of $1200 USD. Because he is a young businessman and this is his first loan, Iftihar is especially grateful to everyone who chooses to support him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Iftihar would like to increase his inventory of phones and accesories to sell.

loans.name: Eufrasia

texts.es:
Eufrasia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos jóvenes, estudió el quinto año de primaria y vive en Jr. Chinchaya s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Desde hace 5 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/.300, aumentó su capital para comprar carne de la feria en Juli. A los 15 años de edad comenzó a trabajar vendiendo refrescos en el mercado, no estudió porque eran muchos hermanos y sus padres no tenían dinero para poder hacerlos estudiar, después de 25 años cambió de negocio y actualmente se dedica a la venta de carne.

Con este préstamo de 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 06 corderos a  S/. 120.00 cada uno.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda muy grande de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Eufrasia is 42-years-old, is married, has 2 young children, and studied through her fifth year of primary school. She lives in the Chinchaya area in the district of Juli, in the province of Chuchito, in the department of Puno. She has been a member of the "Niño San Salvador" communal bank for 5 years. She started with a loan of 300 nuevos soles and increased her capital to purchase meat at the Juli market. At 15 years of age, she started to work selling soft drinks in the market. She didn't continue her education because she has a lot of siblings, and her parents didn't have enough money to give them an education. After 25 years, she switched businesses, and currently she sells meat. With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 6 lambs at 120 nuevos soles each. Her biggest dream is to start a large general store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase 6 lambs at 120 nuevos soles each

loans.name: Veronia Beatriz

texts.es:
Verónica es vivandera, se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de la zona de cota cota de la ciudad de La Paz
Vive en la zona de Cota Cota, sector sur de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus padres
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, que será de gran ayuda ya que le permitirá comprar insumos en cantidad y disminuirán sus costos.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos (papa, arroz, fideo, aceite).
texts.en:
Veronica sells food items from her stand in the Cota Cota district of La Paz. She lives with her parents in Cota Cota which is in the south of La Paz. This is the first time that she's applied for a loan. It will be a great help to her because it will allow her to buy supplies in bulk and thereby lower her costs. The loan will be used to buy supplies for her business (potatoes, rice, pasta, cooking oil).

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Natalie

texts.es: Natalie tiene 29 años, es casada, vive con su pareja y su hija de 6 años. Ella es una mujer muy preocupada por la apariencia física, lo que algunos consideran un defecto, pero que en el caso Natalie se convirtió en una oportunidad de negocio, ya que gracias a ello se dedica a vender productos de belleza desde hace 3 años, lo que realiza a través de catálogos, los cuales lleva a las universidades y a su mismo centro de trabajo, donde sus clientas siempre esperan verse mejor cada día, lo cual beneficia su actividad económica. Sin embargo, ha tenido algunos problemas de  pago, y para recuperar su capital  tiene que insistir y presionar a las personas, siendo esto lo más tedioso de su labor, y en base a esta experiencia Natalie evalúa muy bien a sus posibles clientes. Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, y es una  joven muy responsable dentro de su grupo. Natalie desea incursionar ahora en la venta de productos medicinales muy buenos y solicitados, para ello invertirá 200 soles y el resto en productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Natalie is 29 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six-year-old daughter. She is a woman very concerned about physical appearance, something others see as a fault, but in this case, Natalie turned it into a business opportunity. Thanks to that, she has been selling beauty products through a catalog for three years. She takes her catalogs to universities and to her workplace, where her customers wait to see her every day, which helps her economically. Nevertheless, she has had some problems with being paid and recuperating her expenses. She has had to put pressure on some people, feeling that this is harder than her actual work. Because of this experience, Natalie now evaluates her potential customers very well. This is her second loan from Kiva partner MFP, and she is a very responsible woman among her peers. Natalie now wants to sell quality medical products that are in demand. She will invest 200 soles in this, and the rest in beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medical and cosmetic products

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M., who has sold groceries and footwear since 1998 in Elmina, is married to a fisherman and has four dependents.  Responsible for caring for her family's financial needs and the children's school fees, Florence is requesting a loan to meet increased customer demand for groceries and footwear. 

She hopes to put the increased profits from her business toward a house for her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of groceries and footwear to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Seema Sardar Masih Group
loans.use: To buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en: Rafail is single and lives in the Khachmaz region, in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. He has been in the poultry business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy poultry for improving his poultry business.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Parveen Sadiq Mashi Group

texts.en:
My name is Parveen and I’m a 46-year-old widow. I live in Lahore which famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. I’m a mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. My son works in an iron business where he uses iron for making iron rods. My daughter is 14 years old and she studied in the 7th standard. When my husband died, my daughter quit her studies but I and my son motivated her to study further. I work in a clothes selling business. I buy clothes from the famous markets of Lahore such as “Azam Market & Ichra” and sell in the community to my neighbors. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy iron to expand my son’s iron rods making business.

I am the group leader of four other women from my locality. Nargis Baji and Ashi Baji each want a loan to buy iron to sell. Akbari Baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Asma Baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switch boards and switches) to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods to sell

loans.name: Rabya Group

texts.en:
Rabya is the group leader of Rabya group. There are four members in this group. They live in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. All of them would like to receive money for their business.

Rabya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling vegetables because he wants to make his shop larger. N. K. wants to take a loan for his business, a cart part shop. He wants to buy a new machine for his shop. Shayma wants to take a loan for her business, a bakery in her house, so she can buy stick for her business. And M. Nazyer, a butcher, wants to take a loan for his business because he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

They especially want to thank Kiva and AFSG, Kiva's partner, for this loan process in Afghanistan that helps poor people.

loans.use: They want to expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and married to a 50 year old man named Armando V.. The couple was blessed with three children - two boys and one girl. The couple lives with their children in a semi-rural area of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Their children are very responsible, obedient and helpful. The two boys are their helpers in their furniture shop during weekends, while their daughter helps with the household chores. 

Even though they have a furniture business, their income is not enough to sustain all their daily needs, and that’s why Evelyn start a small piggery in their backyard to provide additional income. But Evelyn needs more funds for the feed supply of her pigs, and that’s why she is asking for some financial assistance from ASKI. She is asking for a loan of PHP12,000.00 to buy more feed supply for her pigs. She wants to make her pigs healthy, so that if she sells them, she will be able to earn more income. With her income, she will be able to help her husband in providing for their family's needs, especially the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy more feed supply.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila L. is from the village of Mansabay. She is 66 years old. Zoila is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Zoila owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zoila has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Zoila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zoila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Zoila is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Zoila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa P. is from the village of Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Leonisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonisa owns & operates a "sari-sari" or retail store.
