The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Leonisa is just starting this business.

In 2008, Leonisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" or retail store. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leonisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for their basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Betilde Ivone

texts.es: La señora Betilde, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 23 años de edad, 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando.Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de Arreglo y Venta de Relojes, ubicada en un local alquilado frente a la plaza de la ciudad, posteriormente poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su relojeria a comprar relojes o para que les brinde el servicio de arreglo, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con alegría y entusiasmo. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, invertirá comprando mas relojes en diferentes modelos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños; correas, pilas de reloj. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de lentes, que agregara a sus productos y así continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Betilde, anhela implementar mas su relojería y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo logra.   Agradece el apoyo que viene recibiendo  para emprender su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Betilde is a member of the communal bank “El Tiempo es Oro.” She lives with her partner, is 23 years old, and has two children, one of whom is a student. Her enterprising character and love for her family motivated her to start her own business of fixing and selling watches. She rents a space in front of the city plaza. Bit by bit she has been gaining experience in watch repair and sale and has become well known and loved by her clients. Nowadays she has loyal clients who come daily to buy watches or have them fixed. She takes care of them personally (happily and enthusiastically). With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy more watches in different styles for men, women, and children. She will also buy watchbands and batteries. Some of the money will be invest in buying eyeglasses that she will add to her products and continue providing better and better service to her clients. Betilde longs to have her own watch shop and she will because she is woman who gets what she wants. She is grateful for the support she gets to help her have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara relojes para aumentar su stock

loans.name: Gufron

texts.en:
T. Gufron is married and has two children. He runs a small business selling wheat, corn and sunflower seeds in the local market. His place is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Gufron has been in this business for over 12 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business. Gufron is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to increase the assortment of his selling inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Gufron's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy wheat, corn and sunflower seeds

loans.name: Gafor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Махмудов Гаффор-49 летний мужчина со средним образованием ,женат имеет 4х детей.Занимается куплей-продажей скота уже много лет, но у него ещё есть и другой семейный доход-у него автомашина марки Газель которую он запустил на рейс и в среднем  его доход составляет 500 сом. в месяц.Его основным делом является бизнес скотом. Он закупает скот со всех рынков района и на базарный день продает за хорошие деньги.За скотом присматривает его жена Санавбар, корм  он не покупает так как он выращивает на своем участке.Гафор работает с нашей организацией и получает выгоду,так как за наличные деньги он покупает скот подешевле и он благодарен нам.
texts.en:
Gafor M. is a 49-year-old man, who is married and has 4 children. He has secondary education. He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for many years, but he also has another small source of family income. Gafor owns a Gazel vehicle, which he placed into shuttle service. This business brings in an average monthly income is 500 somoni. However, his primarily activity is the livestock business. He buys livestock from all the district markets and resells it for good money on market days. Gafor's wife, Sanavbar, looks after the livestock. He does not buy livestock feed since he grows it on his own land. Gafor gets a benefit when he works with our organization because he can use cash to purchase livestock cheaper. He is grateful to us.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ilem B Group

texts.en:
Claudina is a member of the Ilem B borrower group in Mwanjelwa,Mbeya,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.her children are aged 4 and 2 years.

Claudina started her own cafe business selling food 4 years ago,she works 11 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Claudina first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,sugar,tomatoes for her business.


with the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Claudina hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

Felisiana is another member of the same borrower she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,cooking oil,sugar

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
El señor Mariano M. se dedica a la actividad agrícola en el municipio de Telica en el departamento de León donde se ha desempeñado en la siembra de maíz y para llevar a cabo esta actividad debe invertir en los cultivos.

Actualmente, el señor Mariano ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos para invertirlos en el cultivo de maíz porque requiere tener una buena cosecha para así mejorar su condición y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Mariano M. works in agriculture in the municipality of Telica in the state of Leon where he has been engaged in planting corn. In order to carry out this endeavor he must invest in the crops.

At this time Mariano has petitioned Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs in order to invest them in the cultivation of corn. He is in need of a good harvest so that he can improve his and his family’s situation.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the planting of corn

loans.name: Miciryona

texts.en:
Miciryona S. is currently in the business of distilling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more yeast for distillation.

Miciryona is 36 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more yeast for distillation

loans.name: Sumbua

texts.en:
Sumbua B. runs a restaurant that serves tea and bread. Her restaurant walls are thatched with papyrus. Sumbua is requesting a loan in order to buy siding made of iron sheets to cover the walls of her restaurant.

Sumbua is 29 years old and is married to a policeman. She has two children. Both her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Sumbua hopes to be able to build a backer for the restaurant walls.


About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheet siding for the papyrus walls of her restaurant.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane M. is a 37-year-old woman and lives in the town of Vaimoso Fou.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Diane  runs a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community.  Diane has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2009 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Diane joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Diane is requesting for the first time, a loan from SPBD.    Diane is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  Diane plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand her business.

Diane was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09. 

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 28-year-old engaged man. He has owned a phone shop called "Mahmoud Groupe" since 2007 where he buys and repair phones. Today, Mahmoud is requesting to borrow $1,200 to add new decor and renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: Add new decor and renovate his shop

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Ríos, tiene 31 años de edad, desde hace diez años labora como comerciante en el mercado Huembes, habita en un barrio pobre del municipio de Ticuantepe, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder ver construida su vivienda, ella con sus propios esfuerzos y el de su esposo ha construido gran parte de su casa , en una ocasión se le metieron a robar por las mimas condiciones que no es segura , con este financiamiento va a comprar materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y las puertas de la misma , ella tiene tres hijos de dos, cuatro y ocho años , los sueños de la señora es poder darle estudios a sus pequeños y seguridad para que pasen por todas las dificultades que ella a enfrentado . Agradece a la institución por la confianza que le brinda en su primer crédito  ya que son muchas las familias que se beneficia y lograr optar por un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Maria Ríos, 31, has worked as a businesswoman in the Huembes market for over ten years. She lives in a poor neighborhood in the Ticuantepe municipality. The biggest difficulty she faces is not being able to see her house built. With their own efforts, she and her husband have built a big part of her house. One time people entered the house to rob it because it is not secure. With this loan she will buy construction materials like sand, cement, and cement doors. She has three children; two, four, and eight years old. Her dream is to be able to give her little ones an education. She also wants to give them security so that they do not have to face the same difficulties that she has had to face. She is grateful to the institution for the trust shown in giving her the first loan. There are a lot of families who benefit and are then able to achieve better well being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy windows, sand, and cement to tile her floor

loans.name: Edy Moises

texts.es:
El socio EDY MOISES pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

El socio tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El socio es un comerciante que vende material educativo en diferentes ciudades como Cusco, Urubamba, Quillabamba, Puerto Maldonado y Puno. El socio viaja a la cuidad de Arequipa y compra el material de la empresa mayorista “MASETA”. El socio vende el material en las ferias en las ciudades antes mencionadas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que quiere salir adelante y darse una mejor calidad de vida. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de más material educativo.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Edy Moises is a member of the Virgen de Chapi Communal Bank. He is a merchant who sells educational material in different cities like Cusco, Urumbamba, Quillabamba, Puerto Maldonado, and Puno. He travels to the city of Arequipa and buys the material from Maseta, a wholesale business. He sells the material in the fairs in the previously mentioned cities. He has worked in this business for several years. It has gone very well for him thanks to all of the effort that he puts into his work. He is an enterprising and hard-working member who wants to get ahead and have a better quality of life He needs the loan to buy more educational material. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more educational material

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the town of Paludpud Lapaz, Tarlac. She is 55 years old. Teresita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: El

texts.en: El H., 44, lives in the area of located over-crown Islamic people, in Cambodia. She is married with three kids, all three of whom are teenagers and attend the public secondary school. To earn a living, El H. and her husband buy chickens in bulk at reasonable prices from rural people and they then bring them to the market retail sellers for a profit. Normally they generate their income approximate of over $10 per day to cover their entire family’s daily expenses. Due to the approaching fish season when the fish is at special lowest prices El H. proposes to use this great occasion to make extra income by investing in fish sale trade.  Because of her lack money, she requests a loan as capital to buy fresh fish and she will turn them into paste fish for selling.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en: Exaltacion is a 59-year-old mother of two. She is married to Remgio. Both of them are farmers. She helps her husband cultivate their land for rice crops. She works hard to keep up with the growing needs in her household. She is currently in need of additional capital for her farm. She applied for a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used for farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Señor Julio Cesar R. A., labora como Comprador  en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA, el tiene dos   hijos a su cargo y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido nueve créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales eléctricos para el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado.

Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Julio Cesar dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Cesar R. A. works as a buyer at the Nicarguan German Professional Training Center (abbreviated CECNA in Spanish). He has two school-aged children and is married. He has had nine loans with Ceprodel in eight years. In this period of time, he has invested his nine loans in improving his home, thanks to the financing offered to him by Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. He will invest the requested loan in the purchase of electrical materials like an electrical system for his home since the one he has is in bad shape. He is doing all of this with the objective of offering more safety and better living conditions to his children. Julio Cesar said that the loans he has been offered have gone toward improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Lidia Sumelda

texts.es: Lidia Sumelda tiene 46 años, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos y por las noches ofrece el servicio de comida. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace mas 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos a su familia. Ella dio inicio, a esta actividad porque tenía desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el pan de cada día humildemente. Ella sueña con tener una tienda grande en donde ofrezca una variedad de productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima, este no es el primer financiamiento pues han sido muy beneficiosos.
texts.en:
Lidia Sumelda, 46, sells soft-drinks and during the evening, prepared meals. She started this business over 5 years ago and is always looking for ways to produce income for her family. She started this business because she has always enjoyed working, even from a very early age, to earn her keep. She hopes with having a large store where she can stock a variety of products. She will use the funds to buy raw materials. This is not her first loan because they have been of great benefit to her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals preparation.

loans.name: Martha Regina

texts.es: Martha Regina tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad pues siempre le ha gustado y además ha sido muy beneficiosa. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a la venta de leche, cuajada, crema, queso y leche agria. Todos estos producto son muy solicitados por sus clientes, pues ellos aseguran que son de muy buena calidad. Esto motiva a Martha a realizar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es poder establecer un negocio mucho más grande para ofertar al por mayor.
texts.en:
Martha Regina is 49 years old. She makes a living by selling dairy products. She has a lot of experience in this business, since she's always enjoyed it and it's been very profitable. For more than six years, she's been selling milk, curd, cream, cheese, and buttermilk. These are all in high demand by her customers, who say they're good-quality products. Because of this, Martha is requesting a loan that will provide working capital for her to buy raw ingredients. She wants to expand her business and be able to offer her products at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julienne A. P.

texts.fr: H. Julienne A. P. est née en 1963 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Julienne A. P. vit à Davatin,un quartier de Sèmè-podji, au Bénin. Mariée à MEVODJO Louis, un vendeur, Julienne A. P. est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Julienne A. P. vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple se partage les charges familiales. En effet, pour investir dans la scolarisation de son enfant, Julienne A. P. exerce comme activité principale, la vente de poissons congelés, et de l’huile d’arachide à son domicile. Julienne A. P. s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne A. P. a arrêté les classes au cours primaires, mais exerce son activité depuis 15ans. Julienne A. P. a bénéficié déjà d’un prêt auprès de ALIDé, prêt qui a été bien remboursé. Dans le but de renforcer le stock de ses produits Julienne A. P. désire obtenir un deuxième prêt chez ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Julienne A. P. was born in 1963 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  She lives in Davatin, a district of Sèmè-podji, Benin.  Married to MEVODJO Louis, a vendor, she is the mother of one child who is in school.  Julienne A. P. lives together with her husband and child.  Together, the couple are sharing family expenses.  To invest in the education of their child, Julienne A. P. basically has as her main activity a business selling frozen fish and peanut oil out of her home.  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She had dropped out of primary school but has been operating her business for fifteen years.  She has already benefited from a loan from ALIDé that she has repaid.  With the goal of boosting her stock of goods, Julienne A. P. would like a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of frozen fish and some peanut oil

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Universo.
Delia es casada, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos, Delia viaja a diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cochinilla, pieles, carne, productos que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho. En algunas oportunidades venD. frutas en la feria.
Delia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cochinilla.
Los sueños D. Delia son aumentar su capital y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Communal Bank “Universo” (Universe). She is 62 years old, married, and has four children. Delia travels to different fairs in the region to buy cochineal (an insect used to make fabric dye and food coloring), animal hides, and meat so that she can sell these products in the city of Ayacucho. On some occasions, she sells fruit at the fair.

Delia needs a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of cochineal. She dreams of increasing her capital and remodeling her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cochineal (an insect used for making fabric dye and food coloring)

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina P. is 24 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Sina has 2 years of experience in this business.  Sina needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Sina joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina, de 31 años, vive con  su esposo  y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada.Desde hace 10 años, brinda el servicio de transporte con una  combi (movilidad que llega a transportar hasta 12 personas) que  es propia. Su esposo es el chofer  y ella hace el trabajo de cobradora de pasajes, de esta manera diariamente recorren la ruta establecida, pues su movilidad esta inscrita en una  empresa de transportes con ruta definida. El trabajo que realizan empieza desde las primeras horas de las mañana, y se extiende  hasta la noche, con ese esforzado trabajo que realizan han mejorado bastante su economía por lo que tienen planeado para más adelante adquirir  otra movilidad para hacerla trabajar contratando a un chofer.Es la primera  vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser responsable en los pagos y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Ricardina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la reparación y mantenimiento de su movilidad, además comprará  repuestos para su combi para brindarle un mejor mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Ricardina is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. For the past ten years, she has been providing transportation services in her own minibus that holds up to twelve people. Her husband is the driver while she collects bus fare from the passengers. They travel along an established route every day because their vehicle is registered with a transportation company that operates along predetermined routes. Ricardina begins work in the early hours of the morning and continues well into the night. Her hard work has enabled her to significantly improve her finances and she has plans to continue moving forward by acquiring another vehicle and hiring a driver.

This is her first loan with MFP. Ricardina promises to be responsible with her payments and thanks everyone who made this loan possible because it will be very useful for making progress in her business. She plans to invest the money in repairs and maintenance of her vehicle. In addition, she will buy spare parts for her minibus so that it will be adequately maintained.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs & maintenance

loans.name: Ardakbubu's Group

texts.en: Ardakbubu K. is the leader of this group. She is 52 and her husband works as a teacher of French language. They have two daughters and three sons. The daughters are married and live separately with their own families and the other children are students. Ardakbubu has been breeding cattle and cultivating fruits and vegetables since 1994 (in 1994 the collective farms broke up and people received some part of the land for farming). When her husband is free, he helps her with this activity. With money received from the loan, Ardakbubu wants to purchase 150 liters of fuel, which is needed for farming. In the future she plans to increase the number of her cattle to be able to pay for her sons' education. Zholdoshbek S. is 61 and is married. He has raised two sons and two daughters. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Zholdoshbek and his wife have been breeding cattle and farming for sixteen years. Now he wants to obtain a loan to purchase 150 liters of fuel, which is needed for the sowing process. Elmira A. is 43 and is married. She has three daughters and three sons. Two of her daughters study at university, two older sons go to school, and the other children are too young. Elmira and her husband have been breeding cattle and cultivating fruits and vegetables since 1994. Now Elmira has applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fuel for farming. Meerim A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 23 and married with a two-year-old daughter. Meerim and her husband began to breed cattle and cultivate different fruits and vegetables four years ago. She wants to obtain a loan to purchase fuel for farming. In the future, she wants to increase the number of her cattle and improve her family’s living conditions. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for the sowing process

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 50 años,  vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Hace mas de 4 años se dedica a vender productos de belleza de las marcas más reconocidas del mercado. Es así que ofrece gran variedad de productos de buena calidad en perfumes, lápiz labial, rímel entre otros artículos, que son elegidos por catalogo. Además la variedad de muestras que posee son sus herramientas, ya que así sus clientes no dudan en escoger el producto que desean. Este negocio le ha salido rentable por lo que ha decidió incrementar y mejorar sus ventas vendiendo prendas de vestir. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y polos para damas.
texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and son in a house they own. More than 4 years ago, she began selling beauty products from the best-known brands on the market. She offers a great variety of high-quality products, including perfumes, lipstick, mascara, and other items, which her customers choose from catalogs. She also has a variety of samples which she uses as sales tools, so that her customers feel confident in selecting the products they want. This business has been profitable for Elena, and so she has decided to expand it and improve her sales by also selling clothing. This is her second loan with MFP, and she assures us that she will be very responsible with her payments. She expresses her appreciation to the people who will make this loan possible, since it will be very useful to her in advancing her business. With the funds she is requesting, she will invest in buying beauty products and polo shirts for women.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beauty products and clothing to sell

loans.name: Ruth Marisol

texts.es:
Ruth Marisol, tiene 35 años de edad reside en San Miguel, es casada  vive con sus esposo y sus tres hijos, Meybelyn, Javier, Leydi de las edades de 12, 9, 2 años de edad. Su negocio es una  tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad.
Emprendió este negocio con el apoyo de su esposo, y hace cinco años maneja su tienda con éxito, su negocio está en buena zona donde no existe competencia, y lo atiende de 7:00 am -6:00 pm. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para compra de mercadería y abastecer su tienda de productos como son aceite, azúcar, frijoles, detergente, productos de primera necesidad, esto contribuirá a solventar la demanda de sus clientes. Dandole impulso economico asu negocio.
Sus aspiraciones son generar ingresos para su familia, contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Marisol is 35 years old and resides in San Miguel. She is married and lives with her husband and their three children: Meybelyn, Javier, and Leydi (ages 12, 9, and 2). Ruth has a store where she sells basic necessities.

She started her business five years ago with the support of her husband has been able to manage it successfully. Her store is located in a good area where there is no competition. Ruth works from 7am to 6pm. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to restock her store such as oil, sugar, beans, detergent, and other basic necessities so that she can meet the demand of her customers and provide a financial boost to her business.

Her aspirations include generating an income for her family and contributing to the improvement of their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, sugar, beans, detergent, and other basic necessities

loans.name: 04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
"Hóa Lê thị (82) is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Hoằng Hóa.  Hóa is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng hóa (04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng hóa).


Hóa is married and has 3 school-age children.  To making a living, Hóa operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members.  Hóa has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Hóa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hóa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided.  The loan will be her 2nd loan taken from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hóa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê thị Bích (80) is a 23 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  Lê thị Hiền (81) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hóa Lê thị (82) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa.  Hóa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng hóa (04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng hóa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hóa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hóa kiếm được khoảng 5,000,000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hóa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hóa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê thị Bích (80) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  Lê thị Hiền (81) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina C. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Carina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Carina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Carina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carina is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina D. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Maantud, Brgy, Dumalan, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a videoke bar and a general store. Her husband Pedro D., who is 39 years old, works as a miner and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 11 children who are 8 months to 20 years old.  

Ma. Magdalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Magdalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use to expand her business so that she can continue to save up for their future and provide a better life for her children. Ma. Magdalina D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Nieves; tiene 35 años de edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene 3 hijos  trabaja atendiendo su tienda abarrotes y artesanía, La socia elabora diferentes trabajos manuales en sus ratos de óseo, ella mientras atiende la tienda de abarrotes, realiza bellos aretes en alambre y con mostacillas. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en sus materiales y en implementar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su tienda y compra de materiales para su artesanía. 
 
La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Nieves, 35, is a single mother of three children. She works tending to a grocery store and is a craftsperson. She makes a variety of handicrafts during her spare time while she tends to the store. She makes beautiful wire and bead earrings. She needs a loan to buy materials for her crafts and stock items for the grocery store. She is a member of the “LAS PERLAS” (Pearls) communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco province, Cusco department. She makes use of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan and to pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store and supplies for her crafts.

loans.name: Renaldy German

texts.es: Renaldy Germán tiene 28 años, su actividad es la venta de repuestos de computadora y un taller de computación. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio es que ha logrado progresar tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, el es un padre responsable que le enseña pues todos los días tiene que buscar la forma de ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de exhibidores y además comprar computadoras y alguno repuestos necesarios. El sueña con agrandar su local y además proporcionarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Renaldy Germán is 28 years old. He sells computer replacement parts and works in a computer shop. He has had this business for over five years. He has managed to progress because of his great effort and sacrifice. He has one minor child under his care. He is a responsible father who teaches his child that everyday he has to look for a way to earn a living in the most humble way. The loan he is requesting is to buy display cases, computers, and some needed replacement parts. His dream is to expand his place and to give his family a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Jessica tiene 28 años y es madre soltera de dos niños de 10 y 8 años de edad los mismos que están estudiando en la escuela, vive sola con sus hijos.

Tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo,  trabaja  todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 20h00, vende de todo desde productos de primera necesidad hasta bebidas alcohólicas y tarjetas telefónicas, también vende helados Pingüino ya que la empresa le facilito un congelador para vender sus  productos lo cual le genera ganancias extras. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos cuando ellos pueden, dice que le gusta su trabajo  por que le permite estar en su casa y ayudar a sus pequeños hijos con las tareas de la escuela, sus  productos los compra en Comercial Casanova en Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos para surtir su tienda. Es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por la ayuda recibida y por las charlas educativas.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In Arenales, of the parish Crucita, every 15 days there is a meeting of the 6th of July Communal Bank. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of typical dishes of the region.
Jessica is 28 years old and a single mother of two children, aged 8 and 10. Her children attend school, and she lives alone with them.
She has a general store where she works everyday from 7am to 8pm. She sells everything, from basic necessities to alcoholic drinks to telephone cards. She also sells Pingüino ice cream since the company provided her the freezer from which to sell the products, which generates extra profit. Her children help her when they can. She says that she likes her work because it allows her to be at home and to help her children with their homework. She buys her products in the Casanova Commercial Center in Portoviejo.
She will use this loan to buy products to stock her store. This is her third cycle with the communal bank, and she has liked it because of the help she receives and the educational talks.
Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, meat, dairy products and general provisions.

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Para la señora Martha este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gusta por la seriedad tanto de sus compañeras como de la institución ya que reciben los créditos a tiempo y lo que necesitan. Ella tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada y de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos, tres ya mayores y una jovencita de 17 años que es la que vive con ella y  aun estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es comerciante de frutas en  el mercado de Manta.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa el cual atiende los sábados y domingos desde las 7am hasta las 18h00, el plato que más vende es la cuajada (caldo que sale de la preparación del queso). Su hija le ayuda en esto ya que su esposo trabaja todos los días en su negocio de ventas de frutas y verduras.

Este crédito es la mitad para el negocio de la comida para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos y la otra parte para el negocio del esposo. Su sueño es tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales communal bank meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture. In this area, the majority of the people have different businesses such as handicrafts and general commerce.

For Martha, this is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes the reliability of both her fellow group members and the lending institution because they receive the loans on time and receive what they need. Martha is 53 years old, married, and has four children with her husband. Three of her children are already older and her 17-year-old daughter still lives with her and is in high school. Her husband is a fruit salesman at the Manta market.

She has a small dining area in her house which she attends to on Saturdays and Sundays from 7am to 6pm. The dish that she sells the most is cuajada (a curd made from preparing cheese). Her daughter helps her with this since her husband works every day at his fruit and vegetable business.

Half of the loan is for the food business to purchase products to make the dishes, and the other part is for her husband’s business. Her dream is to have a larger place for her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Zareife

texts.en:
Zareife is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee Camp. She is married and a mother of three daughters and two sons. Her husband Kamal owns a small sheep farm on which he raises sheep for sale.

Zareife came to FATEN and took a loan because her husband needs to increase the number of sheep he raises since Al Adha feast is around the corner and demand is increasing.  Zarefei's husband will use the loan for this purpose which will increase their income and improve the family's situation.

Zarefie's husband Kamal appears in the picture here as Zareife, like all Gazans, is very religious and is not comfortable having her picture online.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 años D. edad.  Está casada y tiene seis hijos. No pudo concluir sus estudios, estudió la primaria pero no puso terminarla.
La señora tiene una plastiqueria donD. venD. todo tipo D. productos plásticos, paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. artesanía. Ella  está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue D. S/.300. 00 nuevo soles, lo utilizó para ampliar la mercadería D. su negocio.
Con éste crédito D. S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles,  comprará más productos plásticos al por mayor.-
Su sueño  es conseguir más capital y tener una ferretería bien equipada.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el préstamo D. la cta. Interna y las ganancias D. los ahorros.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “San Salvador” (Holy Savior) Communal Bank, located in the Capachica district, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children.  Julia started but couldn't complete her primary education.

Julia has a plastics shop where she sells all types of plastic products.  At the same time, she sells artisan goods.  Julia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 10 years now.  The 1st loan she requested was for 300 new sols, and was used to expand her business's merchandise.

With this loan of 2,000 new sols, Julia will buy more plastic products at wholesale.  Her dream is to acquire more capital and to have a well-supplied hardware store.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the loans she receives and the earnings on her savings.

loans.use: TO BUY ARTICLES OF PLASTIC AT WHOLESALE TO SELL IN  HER STORE

loans.name: Reut Ole

texts.en:
Reut Ole K. is 24 years old. He is married to Mary K. and he is the father of two children aged three and one years old, respectively.
Reut is a businessman who is involved in selling animals. He has been doing this for the last four years in Narok town. He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy more young bulls to raise and sell later after fattening. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire land for farming to meet the high demand for tomatoes in his area.

His hopes and dreams are to become a great businessman and have his own farm machinery.

Reut is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy more young bulls to fatten and sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan M. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 23 years old. Jonathan is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jonathan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Jonathan is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jonathan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for his  business. Jonathan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jonathan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Benson Kanene

texts.en:
Benson Kanene K. is 25 years old and single.  He is a hardworking man. He has operated a retail shop in Babadogo for eight years with income of 7,100 KES per month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he has never borrowed from any other MFI. Benson's first loan of 20,000 KES will be used to add more stock, such as rice, flour, cooking fat, flour, and soap.  The anticipated profit will be reinvested into the business by purchasing additional stock because customers are attracted by a well stocked shop.  In the future he hopes to own a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase stock of items, e.g., rice, flour, cooking oil, soaps

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four school-aged children. He started working in the car mechanic field 20 years ago.  He represents the only income provider for the family and hopes to increase his family’s income. He has obtained 3 Kiva loans and he has been an excellent client.

He repairs different types of cars. Due to his long experience in this field, he has been able to build a good business reputation. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by completing his set-up with the needed tools and machinery.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Al separarse de su esposo y convertirse en madre cabeza de hogar, Rocío M. Buriticá de Puerto Berrío-Antioquia, se vio obligada a emprender su propio negocio, iniciativa que le permitiría cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Fue así como esta luchadora empezó con una venta de empanadas en la calle, poco a poco y por los pedidos de sus clientes, Rocío, le agregó a sus ventas, pasteles de pollo, empanadas, arepas de huevo y otros productos de gran acogida en la zona. 

Actualmente el punto de venta de Rocío está conformado por una mesa y algunas sillas que ubica parta la comodidad de sus clientes. Para mejorar la producción y hacer sus productos en menor tiempo, Rocío necesita de un préstamo para comprar una fritadora, algunos enseres así como insumos para aumentar sus ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos. 

Como gran emprendedora, Rocío espera en un futuro montar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Upon separating from her husband and becoming a mother who was the head of her household, Rocío M. Buriticá of Puerto Berrío-Antioquia found herself obliged to begin her own business, an initiative that would permit her to cover her household expenses. This was how this hard-working woman began selling empanadas on the street. Little by little, and through orders from her customers,  Roció added to her sales with chicken pies, empanadas, corn cakes with eggs, and other products that are welcomed in the area.

Now Roció's sales location is equipped with a table and some chairs that are arranged for the comfort of her customers. To improve production and to make her products in less time, Roció needs a loan to buy a fryer, some tools, and ingredients to increase her sales and thus improve her income.

As a great entrepreneur, in the future Roció wants to set up her own restaurant.

loans.use: Buy a fryer, tools, and ingredients

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en:
Sarantsetseg, 30, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on land that they own. Her husband operates a public transportation business.
Sarantsetseg opened a food shop with her husband in 2010 in addition to her job as a baker in a local bakery shop. She is requesting a loan of 650,000 MNT to purchase more food for her shop. She is trying to expand her business. Sarantsetseg is a modest and kind person who says, "Now my husband has a motorbike and I wish to help him to buy a car."

loans.use: To purchase more food for her shop

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man with two children, one of whom attends school. He is married to a housewife who helps with the upbringing of the kids. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

Simon operates a retail shop, selling maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice to his neighbours and passersby. He plans to pay back this loan well so that he can qualify for more loans in the future. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he plans to purchase bundles of wheat flour, five crates of soda and boxes of washing detergents. His long-term plan is to expand his business so that he can support his family in terms of their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, five crates of soda and boxes of washing detergents

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  SEYDOU M.  est âgé de 46 ans qui vit avec ses six enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Dongorona, un des villages de la sous préfecture  de OUELESSEBOUGOU,  Région de Koulikoro.
SEYDOU M. n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de Dongorona  et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins deux mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
SEYDOU M. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000  FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en: Mr. Seydou M. is 46 years old and lives with his six children and his wife in a traditional family in Dongorona, a village in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, Region of Koulikoro. He did not have the chance to go to school. Early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying, storing, and selling of grains. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who was once a major grains merchant. Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is now on his first individual loan that will be used to buy 2 tonnes of grains (corn, beans, millet, fonio) from peasant producers in and around Dongorona. He will keep the grains for at least two months.  He essentially sells wholesale to a customer base composed of retailers from big cities, such as Bamako. Seydou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer, 27 years old, lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is married and has 4 children, the oldest only 6 years old.

Jenifer is a farmer. She has been growing pineapples for 5 years and earns about 3,000 PHP from it. Jenifer also buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her town and then sells them in her neighborhood. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers for farming and fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for farming and fish to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Paulina, es casada y tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos son completamente independientes y solo tiene a 1 de 17 años en su casa apoyándolo en sus estudios y otras necesidades; la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ella tiene terrenos en los cuales producen papas, maíz, cebollas, habas. La socia también en otra época del año se dedica a la venta de maíz grano secos, la socia compra maíz al por mayor y los vende en granos secos al por menor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos secos de maíz para realizar harina de maíz, cremas de maíz, y otros platos típicos en la región. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos secos de maíz.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Paulina is a member of the San Martin de Zurite Community Bank which is located in Zurite, in the province of Anta, in Cusco Department. She is 48-years old, married, and has six children; five of them are independent, so she only has her 17-year old son to support while he finishes school.

Paulina’s main work is farming. She grows potatoes, corn, onions, and beans. At certain times of the year she sells dried corn--she buys the corn wholesale and then sells it at retail prices. She is seeking a loan to to buy more dried corn to make maize flour and soups as well as other local dishes. 

Paulina is grateful for this valuable loan and promises to make the repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy dried corn

loans.name: Rowela

texts.en:
Rowela is 40 years old and married with three children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs, and is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins. Rowela has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for hogs

loans.name: Fazila

texts.ru: Фазила проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. У нее среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке "Дехкон". Арендует торговую точку, где продает рис и маш. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для покупки новых сортов риса.
texts.en: Fazila lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 53 years old, married, and has eight children. She has a secondary education. She trades in the market called “Dekhon.”  She rents a shop where she sells rice and mung beans. She has been doing this for twelve years. She is taking out a loan to buy new varieties of rice.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of rice.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, he has operated a carpentry business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Silas faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting charcoal and high competition from other carpentry operators. He dreams of expanding his workshop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase wood, gum and timber for his carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, gum and timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is a 50-year-old married woman with two sons and a daughter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her family has earned a living by renting furniture for the past 37 years. This business is the only income source of her family. 

She intends to take a loan to buy chicken and fish that she will then resell in a small local market. She hopes this will provide the family with an extra regular income source to sustain their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fish to sell

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 27-year-old woman and a mother for three young children. Suha and her husband  Alaa Aldeen, are trying their best to provide their kids a restful life in the future, so Alaa Aldeen started working in two jobs and Suha decided to work from her home selling cosmetics products.

It has been two years now since Suha started her small business to help her husband, selling cosmetics products such as make-up, but now she is applying for a loan to add more types of cosmetics and perfumes, in order for her to open a special cosmetics store to cover a wider area.

Since Suha is a conservative person, her husband Alaa Aldeen has agreed to be in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To add perfumes to the cosmetics products that she sells.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI I  est constitué de 10 femmes mariées du village de SANANKORO dans la sous préfecture de SELINGUE, région de SIKASSO (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 40  ans,  7 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide, du gombo et de mil.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  deuxième  prêt  de campagne.
FATOUMA, qui est la deuxième assise à droite,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide et de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU,SELINGUE et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
FATOUMA compte  réaliser, après l’écoulement de ses produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 95.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et l pour es dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 10 married women from the village of Sanankoro, in the Selingue prefecture, in the Sikasso district (third administrative district in the Republic of Mali).  They live in traditional families, are on average 40 years old, have seven children, and grow groundnuts, okra, and millet.

In the hopes of making their agricultural ventures more profitable, the members of the group decided to work with the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their second loan of the year.

Fatouma, who is seated second from the right, intends to use her loan to purchase adequate quantities of groundnut seed and millet, small tools and agricultural inputs from the large market in Selefougou.  Following the winter season, the harvests will be stored for a certain amount of time so that they increase in value before sale.  They are then sold at the main market in Selefougou, Selingue, and in the surrounding markets, individually and often in bulk, for cash from a clientele who come mostly from the big cities.

After dispersing the agricultural products, Fatouma intends to earn a profit of 95,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the interest on her loan and for the ongoing expenses of her family.

loans.use:
Achat  d’intrants, semences  et petits matériels.
to purchase agricultural inputs, seeds, and small tools

loans.name: Yonis Alberto

texts.es:
Yonis es un joven de 24 años de edad, casado, aun no es padre, el trabaja en una tienda de vendedor, a si mismo su esposa, el tiene cinco años laborando en la tienda, pues es un joven de poco recursos economico el cual quiere progresar al tener mejores condiciones de vivienda. Tambien ha trabajado en construccion y ha salido adelante bajo las circuntancias economica de su familia.
actualmente su casa es de madera, en donde ha pasado dificultades de sol y agua, ahora que esta casado le impulsa superarse para ambos y con apoyo de su pareja, quieren construir su cuarto de concreto.
el no cuenta con el capital suficiente, para comenzar, pero atravez de Afodenic, se le hara posible la compra de materiales de construccion en piedra, bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, clavos, tabla. Para comenzar su cuarto. Esta sastifecho por esta mejora que comenzara y que le dara mejores condiciones de higiene y seguridad.
texts.en:
Yonis is a young man of 24.  He is married but is not a father yet.  He works as a shop assistant in a store, as does his wife.  He has been working in the store for five years.  Yonis is a young man with limited financial means who would like to make progress and improve the condition of his home.  He has also worked in construction and has gotten ahead in life despite the financial circumstances of his family.

Currently, Yonis' home is made from wood and he has experienced problems with sun and water.  Now that he is married, he would like to do better for both himself and his wife.  With the support of his wife, he would like to build a room from concrete.

Yonis does not have the capital he needs to start this work but, through Afodenic, he will be able to buy construction supplies (stone, blocks, sand, cement, iron, nails and planks) and start building his room.  He is happy that he will be able to start making this improvement as it will provide him with better hygiene and safety.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to start building a room

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2002. Elle vend seule à ses nombreux clients au marché de HEDZRANAWOE. Elle achète les produits à ANIE. 
Akoua a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales.
texts.en:
Akoua is a woman of 38 and single.  She has been selling cereals since 2002. She works alone, selling to her numerous customers at the market of HEDZRANAWOE. She buys her wares in ANIE. 

Akoua has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: 13 De Junio Group

texts.es:
13 de Junio es denominado el comité de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está integrado por 10 mujeres de esa ciudad. Dicho grupo se forma a iniciativa de una de las miembros del grupo, la cual oyó hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y organizó a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surge el grupo. Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy sacrificadas, que día a día luchan por salir adelante y generar ingresos para sus hijos y familiares.
